loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 46 years old and married with three children who are in school.

Marlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Marlyn has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from food vending.

Marlyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her 'sari-sari' store

loans.name: Maitta

texts.en:
Maitta is a 30 year-old business woman from Liberia.  She is married and has three children between seven and four; they are currently attending school and live at home. She describes herself as a working woman.

She lives and works in St. Paul.  St. Paul is the home of the oldest market in Liberia, and is known for their fish because of its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the free-port.  It is one of the poorer areas, and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Maitta has had a table business for the past ten years, selling onion, palm oil, rice, etc.  She started her business by selling for her mother. She works ten hours at her business, and her greatest challenge in business is the small income. 

She intends to use the loan to buy inventory.   Maitta likes her business because she makes more profit.  

She hopes to one day own a house.  

Thank you for supporting the borrowers at BRAC Liberia!

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice.  

Nenita  is borrowing PHP 25,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store business, like soap, cream, milk, sugar, and soft drinks.

Nenita successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell, like soap, cream, milk, sugar, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Nohn

texts.en:
Nohn is a 40 year old business woman from Liberia.  She is married and has three children between the ages of 20 and 10. Two of her children are currently attending school and live at home.  She did not go to school, but she is good at managing her business.  She describes herself as a working woman.

She lives and works in St. Paul.  St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish because of its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the free-port.  It is one of the poorer areas, and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Nohn has had a table business for the past ten years, selling soft drinks.  She started her business by selling for her mother.  She works ten hours at her business, and her greatest challenge in business is the small income. 

Nohn intends to use the loan to buy inventory.   She likes her business because she makes more profit.  

She hopes to one day own a house.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Yulduz

texts.ru:
Юлдуз родилась в Спитаменском районе. Ей 25 лет, не замужем. Юлдуз очень жизнерадостная, весёлая девушка. Со школьных лет Юлдуз интересовалась английским языком. После окончания школы Юлдуз поступила в ВУЗ на  факультет иностранных языков. В семье их двое Юлдуз и её братишка, который тоже учится в университете. Мать Юлдуз домохозяйка, а отец является мигрантом в РФ. Юлдуз занимается своей любимой профессией, обучает детей английскому языку у себя дома. Она репетитор. 
Матери Юлдуз необходимо лечение так как она в возрасте и со здоровьем у нее проблемы. Проявляя свою любовь к матери, Юлдуз сама хочет оплатить за лечение своей матери. Узнав у знакомых об организации Арванд Юлдуз обратилась за кредитом. На полученный кредит Юлдуз хочет купить все необходимые медикаменты.  Юлдуз выражает свою благодарность организии МДО "Арванд" за содействие.
texts.en:
Yulduz was born in the Spitamen area.  She is 25 years old and is not married.  Yulduz is a cheerful, happy young woman.  Yulduz became interested in the English language in school.  After finishing school Yulduz entered college to study foreign languages.  In the family there are two children, Yulduz and her brother who also studies at university.  Yulduz's mother is a homemaker, her father is a migrant laborer in the Russian Federation.  Yulduz works in her chosen field, teaching children English in her home.  She is a tutor.

Yulduz's mother needs treatment as she is older and has health problems.  Showing her love for her mother, Yulduz would like to pay for her mother's treatment.  She applied for a loan after learning from acquaintances about Arvand.  Yulduz plans to use her loan to purchase all the necessary medicines.  Yulduz is grateful to MDO Arvand for its assistance.

loans.use: to purchase medicines for her mother

loans.name: Las Inocentes Group

texts.es:
Doña Margarita es una mujer emprendedora de 45 años de edad estudio la secundaria y no tuvo más oportunidad de continuar con sus estudio pero su madre le enseño a trabajar la casa y a cocinar, lo cual le ayudo mucho a través de los años ya que por más de 20 años se ha dedicado a la venta de antojitos Mexicanos, con esta actividad logró sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente ella se dedica a la venta de pollos Asados los fines de semana (sábados y domingos) desde su hogar y le está yendo muy bien, lo que más le gusta  de su actividad es que solo es el fin de semana, gana su dinero y hace lo que más le gusta que es cocinar, la gente que le compra pollos dice que son muy ricos porque doña Margarita tiene buen sazón.
Un crédito de VisiónFund le ayudara a comprar pollos para continuar realizando sus ventas.
Ella quiere que su negocio continúe progresando y a futuro le gustaría iniciar una nueva actividad.
Ella pertenece al grupo llamado las inocentes y se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de la Reforma.
Está integrado por:
Karina venta de zapatos, 
Rosa Maria venta de zapatos,
Elizabeth venta de pollo,
Jannet  venta de bisutería,
Minerva venta de abarrotes,
texts.en:
Margarita’s an enterprising 45-year-old woman who attended secondary school but was unable to continue further with her schooling but her mother taught her to work at home and to cook which helped her much through the years since for more than 20 years she’s worked selling Mexican fast-food snacks.  She was able to move her family forward thanks to this activity.

She currently works selling roasted chickens on the weekend (Saturdays and Sundays) at home and she’s doing very well.  What she likes best about her activity is that it’s only weekends.  She earns her money and does what she likes best which is cooking.   The people who buy her chickens say they are delicious because Margarita is a very tasty cook.

A VisiónFund loan will help her buy chickens to continue with her sales.  She wants her business to continue making progress and in future she’d like to start a new activity.  She belongs to the group called “Las Inocentes” (The Innocent Ones) located in the community of La Reforma.

The group consists of:
Karina - shoe sales, 
Rosa María - shoe sales,
Elizabeth -chicken sales,
Jannet - costume jewelry sales,
Minerva - grocery sales.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

location.town: La Reforma, San Miguel Soyaltepec, Oaxaca

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling "nipa," woven palm mats used for house repair and construction in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional nipa to sell.  Carolina has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from farming rice and buying and selling rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her "nipa", rice-sales and farming rice businesses.

Carolina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To buying and selling "nipa", woven palm mats used for house repair and construction

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is 59 years old and married with 10 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soap, canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

Leonisa has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Leonisa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soap, canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is 50 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Maria Elena has a tailoring shop in the Philippines. Maria Elena requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business.

Maria Elena has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for tailoring business

loans.name: Emmalyn

texts.en:
Emmalyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Emmalyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to re-stock, like canned goods, eggs, rice, soap, and spices.

Emmalyn has been in this business for three years now. She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Emmalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to re-stock, like canned goods, eggs, rice, soap, and spices

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es: La señora Ana Isbael, habita en el km 10 1/2 carretera Masaya, junto a su esposo e hijos, su mayor sueño es poder terminar de construir su casita, para asi mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ella trabaja como comerciante al igual su esposa entre los dos se dividen los gastos del hogar, la dificultad que se les presenta es que no pueden recaudar el dinero de una sola vez, con este credito que se  le ha otrogado comprara Materiales como: Bloques, Cemento, Arena, Hierro etc. Doña Ana Isabel Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en:
Ana Isabel lives with her husband and children at the 10 ½ kilometer point on the Masaya highway.  Her biggest dream is to be able to finish building her house.  This way she will improve their living conditions.

She works as a merchant, like her husband.  They split the household expenses between the two of them.  The difficulty she faces is not being able to get together the money all at once.  With the loan she has been granted she will buy materials like cement blocks, cement, sand, and iron, etc.

Ana Isabel is grateful for the support that Afodenic and the Kiva loan have given her.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
El señor José Antonio tiene49 años de edad, es originario de Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas esta casado con la señora Juana, con quien tiene cuatro hijos que ya están casados y tiene su propia familia.
El señor José Antonio tiene más de 06 años dedicándose a la carpintería, albañilería y plomería, esta es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para el y su esposa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un carro que le esta haciendo falta para poder ir a realizar sus trabajosa los domicilios particulares.
Desea mejorar la calidad de servicio y llegar a tiempo a sus trabajos para que lo puedan recomendar con otras personas, y así podrá generar mas ingreso.
Con las ganancias que obtiene de sus trabajos es para pagar el crédito ya que sus hijos le ayudaran con los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
José Antonio, age 49, is from Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas.  He is married to Juana, and they have four children who are now married and have their own families.

José Antonio has been working in carpentry, bricklaying, and plumbing for over six years.  This is the source of income that he has for himself and his wife.

He is requesting a loan to buy a car that he needs to be able to go to do jobs at private homes.  He wishes to improve the quality of service and to get to his jobs on time so that they can recommend him to other people.  This way he will be able to generate more income.

The earnings that he gets from his job are to repay the loan because his children will help him with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy a car for his business.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like sugar, milk, coffee, noodles, eggs, spices, etc. for her general store business.

Geraldine has been in this business for 11 years. She earns more income from lodging house rental and  from buying and selling charcoal.

She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store, lodging house, and charcoal businesses.

Geraldine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell like sugar, milk, coffee, noodles, eggs, spices, etc

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Cecilia works hard to support her family.

She has a ambulant tobacco-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Cecilia is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of tobacco to sell for her ambulant vending tobacco business.

She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her ambulant vending of tobacco and pig-raising business.

Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of tobacco to sell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is 62 years old and married with three children.

He earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Francisco is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins for his pigs.

Francisco has been raising pigs for 40 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and rice and from his general store.

He is working tirelessly toward the attainment of his dream: to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins for his pigs

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Gina is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional items like soap, eggs, sugar, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like soap, eggs, sugar and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen Mayor de edad casada con dos hijos menores de edad,  originaria del municipio de Chinandega zona que se caracteriza por ser muy productiva en el ámbito comercial, María es propietaria de una joyería, relojería ubicada en uno de los mercados donde ella alquila el local, ha demostrado ser una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta que ha logrado salir adelante con muchos esfuerzos debido a que no desea que sus hijos pasen las necesidades que ella paso en su juventud que con costo logro terminar estudiar la secundaria, uno de sus sueños es poder ver culminado los estudios de sus hijos y verlos convertidos en profesionales, al igual que mejorar sus vivienda y así ofrecerle un lugar digno de vivir a sus hijos, ella tiene clientes fijos y eventuales los cuales les ofrece sus productos al contado y al crédito los cuales los recupera semanal y quincenal, el objetivo de este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como es el oro, para asi continuar con su demandas que ha ido creciendo, María agradece mucho la oportunidad que los inversionistas Kivas les está ofreciendo a las personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
María has a jewelry and watch business located in one of the markets where she rents a place.  She has shown herself to be a responsible, hard-working, and honest person who has managed to get ahead with great effort.  She has done so because she does not want her children to experience the needs that she did in her youth.  At an expense, she managed to finish high school.

One of her dreams is to be able to see her children complete their education and become professionals.  She also dreams of improving her house.  This way she will give her children a decent place to live.

She has fixed and casual customers to whom she sells her products for cash and for credit.  She collects weekly and biweekly.

The objective of this loan is to buy raw material like gold in order to continue with her demand, which has been growing.

María is very grateful for the opportunity that the Kiva lenders give to people with scarce financial resources.

loans.use: to buy raw material like gold.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said lives in Malindi, Kenya. He is married and has children who are attending school. For nine months he has been operating a retail shop in his area. He is also a fisherman. This activity also gives him extra income. 

He heard of Milango through friends who invited him to join. He seeks a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to add stock to his shop. This loan will enable him expand his business and get extra income to educate his children.

Despite facing a challenge of theft in his business he says he wants to own a wholesale in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for his shop.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell in her buy-and-sell charcoal business.

Alicia has been in this business for five years. Alicia earns more income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she is requesting a new loan to further build her buy-and-sell charcoal and pig-raising businesses.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 37 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Mamie is single.  She stopped her education at grade 5 and has six children between 19 years and 3 months old, only three of whom are in school and  live at home.  

For the past five years she has been selling Lappa (traditional clothes worn mostly by women), blouses, trousers, etc.  She started this business with a little amount from her fiancee, and she learned this business from her mother.  She likes her business because of the ways people buy from her.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory for her business.  She hopes to get more money and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Siah

texts.en: Siah is 34 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She lives with her fiancée, who is a carpenter, and they have two children, aged 9 and 20, one of whom is in school and lives at home. She describes herself as a hardworking person who, for the past three years, has run a shop where she sells rice and soup in the local market. She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her. She was able to start this business with money given to her by husband. Every day, she buys fresh ingredients, since her shop is close to local market. She is requesting a loan to buy more rice, pepper, fish, dry bush meat, onions, coal and other items  for her business, Her goal for the future is to buy a piece of land and build a house. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia, because they help small business people like her increase their income.

loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, fish, dry bush meat, onions, coal and other items  for her business.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Antonieta works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs. Antonieta is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to  buy additional materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Antonieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business making photo frames in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like wood, bamboo and other native products for her business.

Dolores has been in this business for one year. Dolores earns additional income from making furniture and buying and selling accessories.

Dolores has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like wood, bamboo and other native products for her business.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is 34 years old and married with three children.

Elna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like eggs, soap, noodles, groceries, etc. to sell.

Elna has borrowed and paid back nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising chickens and pigs.

Elna aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like eggs, soap, noodles and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Jeniffer has been in this business for four years. Jeniffer earns more income from raising pigs.

Jeniffer has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en:
Zeenat is a 39-year-old married women who lives with her husband and a daughter in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her biggest dream in life is to marry her daughter into a good and respectable family. For seven years, Zeenat's husband has been driving a taxi, which is the only source of income for his family. But for the last 10 days he has not been able to generate any income as his taxi stopped working and needs to be repaired. 

Zeenat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to repair her husband's taxi so that he can continue his work. This will not only improve the taxi's condition but will help in improving the family's income as well.

loans.use: To repair the taxi.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell in her fish-vending business.

Norma has been in this business for 10 years. Norma earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Hoi's Group

texts.en:
Hoi was born in 1984. She has three children. Her son is little. Her daughters are aged eight and five. Her husband and she are carpenters to earn a living. He earns about 5,000,000 VND and Hoi earns about 3,500,000 VND per month. She has done this job for seven years. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,500,000 VND per month. 

Her challenge in life and work are the lac of capital to invest in her business and the lack of money to pay fees for her children’s education. Her dream is for her children to grow up well and for her to be able to enlarge her carpentry workshop. This loan is one of the steps that will help her reach to this dream. She can invest in her carpentry workshop to gain more earnings and save the profit for her children’s education. Hoi is a hardworking woman and a passionate businessman. She has a passion for carpentry. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2013. In this first loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. She wants to expand her business and raise her children well.

Other members which are part of Hoi's group include the following: Hang, who is 31 years old. She has three children. She is a seller. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to sell groceries. Tuyen, who is 36 years old. She has three children. She is a carpenter. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. Phuong is 34 years old. She has four children. She is a carpenter. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. Chung is 28 years old. She has three children. She is a carpenter. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. Tam is 36 years old. She has three children. She is a seller in a market. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy chicken meat in the market.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Serwat's Group

texts.en:
Serwat, a member of two-person borrower group, is a 29-year-old woman who is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and three children. Her husband is a diabetic patient and she always worries about his health. Her husband is a carpenter by profession and he has been running a wood shop for five years, which is the only source of income for their family. He is an excellent carpenter and he has good skills and makes quality furniture. 

Serwat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband in his business. Her husband will purchase a wood-cutting machine and some tools like a hammer, nails, wooden sheets etc for his shop. As they have no other source of income, with the help of this loan, her husband will be able to continue his business, and with the net profit they will pay the educational expenses of their children. Serwat dreams of her children having a bright future and prays for her husband's good health.

In the picture Serwat is raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a wood-cutting machine and tools.

loans.name: Lien's Group

texts.en:
Lien was born in 1971. She has a child who is a carpenter. To earn a living, Lien and her husband are carpenters.  He earns about VND 5,000,000 and Lien earns about VND 3,000,000 per month. She has done this job for two years. Her family’s total earnings are about VND 11,000,000 per month. 

Lien's dream is to enlarge her carpentry workshop. However, her challenge is lacking capital to invest in it. This loan is one of the steps to help her reach for this dream. Lien is a hard-working and careful woman. Her family has a tradition of doing carpentry and she loves this job. 

Lien has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2012. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed VND 5,152,000 and repaid it on-time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND 6,496,000 to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

Other members who are part of Lien's Group include the following: 
	 
  Luyen is 26 years old. She has three children. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow VND 9,184,000 to raise ducks. 
	 
  Huyen is 21 years old. She is a carpenter. She wants to borrow VND 5,152,000 to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.
	
  Hanh is 40 years old. She has three children. She is a seller. She wants to borrow VND 5,152,000 to sell beverages and bananas.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est constitué de quatre femmes qui ont bénéficié de prêts remboursés sans difficultés. Elles habitent le même quartier et ont comme activité principale le commerce.

Madame Faty la représentante est mariée, âgée de 43 ans elle est mère d'une fille.Elle mène une activité de vente d'ustensiles, bijoux et tissus;elle a une bonne expérience. Elle est vêtue de bazin saumon et a levé la main gauche.


Elle compte avec son prêt acheter 12 douzaines de verres, 20 douzaines d'assiettes et 12 douzaines de paires de boucles d'oreilles,pour ainsi se faire plus de revenus. 

Avec ses bénéfices elle prend en charge la scolarité de sa fille et envisage d'équiper sa chambre à coucher.
texts.en:
This group consists of four women who benefitted from loans which were reimbursed without difficulty. They live in the same neighborhood and their main business is shopkeeping.

Madam Faty is the representative, married, 43 years old and mother to one daughter. She manages a business selling utensils, jewelry and fabric; she has good experience. She is wearing a salmon-colored bazin and has raised her left hand.

With her loan she plans to buy 12 dozen glasses, 20 dozen plates and 12 dozen pairs of earrings, to make more revenue.

With her profits she takes care of the schooling of her daughter and envisions furnishing her bedroom.

loans.use: to buy utensils and jewelry to resell.

loans.name: Cristo Nos Ama Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cristo nos Ama está conformado por diez integrantes, nueve mujeres y un hombre, madres y padres responsables con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Estas personas son originarias de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del  país. Se caracterizan por ser personas trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus pequeños hijos. Ya que ellos por falta de recursos económicos se vieron obligados a trabajar desde temprana edad. 
La coordinadora del banco comunal es Ramona Mercedes  y tiene por actividad económica  una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan, leche, detergente, jabón. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias, el crédito lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal  Cristo Nos Ama agradece la  ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "Cristo nos Ama" communal bank has ten members - nine women and one man, all responsible parents with a total of twenty children in their charge. These people are originally from Malpaisillo, in the north of the country.  They are hard-working, responsible and have a desire to move ahead in life.  They want to provide their young children with better lives as, because of financial problems, the members of the communal bank had to work from an early age.

The communal bank's coördinator is Ramona Mercedes, who has a grocery store that she runs out of her home.  The grocery store sells soft goods in small quantities.  Ramona sells rice, beans, sugar, bread, milk, detergent, soap and more.  She works for around twelve hours each day.  She needs a loan to invest in working capital and to stock-up her business buying and selling soft goods in order that, in the near future, she can earn a higher income.  The "Crista nos Ama" communal bank thanks Kiva lenders for providing poor people, such as those in Nicaragua, with the opportunity of having a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock-up her grocery store with soft goods such as rice, beans, sugar, bread, milk, detergent and soap.

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es: Jackeline es una joven muy luchadora, ella se ha esforzado para superarse personalmente, por lo que ahora lo que mas anhela es poder estudiar en la universidad. es por ello que solicita un préstamo por un millón cuarenta y cinco mil colones (1.045.000) para la compra de un equipo de cómputo y libros de texto para estudiar. con el préstamo espera poder seguir estudiando y lograr sus metas.
texts.en: Jackeline is a very striving young woman. She has personally struggled to overcome, so what she longs for the most at this time is to able to study at the university. Because of this she is asking for a loan for one million, forty-five thousand Costa Rican colones (1,045,000) to buy computer equipment and books to study. With the loan she hopes to be able to keep studying and to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy equipment and books for education

loans.name: Nour

texts.en:
Nour is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Nour is a 25-year-old married woman from Jabalia. She is also a university student . Her husband is an employee who gets an average salary.  Nour would like to complete her studies, so she would like to buy a new laptop to help her in doing the reports and homework. 
Nour took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This will help Nour in her studies. This will ensure a better future for Nour and her kids.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is from Jabalia and is a university student in his second year. His father is a paint worker who has seasonal work, especially in the summer.
Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This will help him to do his homework and reports and help him in his studies. This will ensure a better future for Mohammad and improve the family's living conditions. Mohammad is photographed with his new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Thomas Andre Bacoumba

texts.fr: Monsieur Thomas André Bacoumba réside au Sénégal. Il s’active  dans le secteur du  commerce  depuis environ 01 ans et demi. Il s’adonne a la vente   de  patte d’arachide  et le revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent de survivre et de supporter une partie de  ses que besoins.  Membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IIMCEC, il sollicite un prêt d’un montant de 150.000 francs CFA  prévu  pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de booster son activité. En effet, il veut augmenter ses ventes et obtenir plus de ressources financières qui lui permettront d’épargner davantage. Il souhaite obtenir une grande boutique où il pourra vendre ses produits de patte d’arachide.
texts.en: Mister Thomas André Bacoumba lives in Sénégal. He has been active in the trade sector for about a year and a half. He devotes himself to the sale of ground nut paste and the revenue that his business brings in allows him to survive and to support part of his needs. A member of one of the branches of the UIMCEC, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 150,000 FCFA to strengthen his working capital in order to boost his business. In fact, he wants to increase his sales and obtain more financial resources which will allow him to save more. He hopes to obtain a large boutique where he will be able to sell his ground nut paste products.

loans.use: to buy ground nut paste to resell.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 50-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband and five children. Her husband is a janitor by profession and he has a very low monthly income, because of which they are facing a lot of financial problems.

Shameem is a very responsible and skilled woman. She is using her tailoring skills to generate an alternative source of income for her family. She is very experienced in stitching clothes and dresses. She has been doing this work from six years. Her clients are very happy and well satisfied with her work. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. She wants to open a tailoring center in her house. She would purchase two new sewing machines so that her production would be increased. She would also purchase some threads and clothes for the stitching purposes. She would pay her installments with the profit amount and pay some household expenses. She is very hopeful that the loan will be a progressive one for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a tailoring machine

loans.name: Amirah

texts.en:
Amirah is a 40-year-old married woman from Nablus. She is a mother with seven sons. One of her son's is a worker with a low wage, which is the only source of income for the family. Amirah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her family to repair the home they are living in now. This will improve the family's living conditions. 

Amirah appears in the Kiva profile picture.

loans.use: to pay the costs of repairing the family house.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is a 40-year-old hardworking married woman who is living in a remote area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and four sons. For the past four years she and her husband have been running a crockery shop. Her husband also works in a clinic, and her elder son is also running a crockery shop in a market. Nusrat has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase crockery items, like glasses, plates, spoons, forks, etc. for her shop. She wants to offer a greater variety of goods to her clients and, as a result, increase her net income in the future. She dreams of opening a new shop for her other two sons. She is hopeful that her business will grow more in the future. She wants to thank all the BRAC staff for being so cooperative.

loans.use: To purchase crockery items

loans.name: Nuha

texts.en:
Nuha is a Palestinian married woman from Jenin. She lives in a small house with her husband and four children: two boys and two girls. For the past few years, Nuha and her husband worked on a chicken farm they own. It has been a profitable project for the family and brings a good income.

Nuha and her husband would like to develop their project by growing some plants in the free land they have. They took a USD loan from FATEN that will help Nuha buy some plants, trees and fertilizers. By developing their project, the income for the family will increase. 

Nuha appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy some plants, trees and fertilizers.

loans.name: Reyad

texts.en:
Reyad is a 63-year-old man from Hebron. He is a father of seven sons and one daughter. The whole family is used to grazing sheep. This family project earns good money but needs a lot of improvements and developments. Reyad would like to increase the number of sheep, so he took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help the family to increase their income from buying more sheep. 

Reyad's wife appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for his farm.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita es madre de tres hijos. Con esfuerzo propio logró levantar su casa pero no logró terminarla, aún debe concluir el muro de retención, el cuarto de pilas y otros detalles importantes, ella está solicitando un millón cuarenta y cinco mil colones (¢1.045.000) para comprar materiales como cemento, piedra , arena , clavos y otros para terminar su vivienda. Es importante para ella y su familia realizar estos trabajos lo antes posible, ya que la época de lluvia ya inició en nuestro país y deben estar protegidos para el fuerte invierno que enfrentarán.
texts.en: Margarita is the mother of three children. With her own effort she managed to start building her house but she did not manage to finish it. She still has to finish the retaining wall, the room with sinks, and other important details. She is asking for one million, forty-five thousand Costa Rican colones (¢1,045,000) to buy materials like cement, stone, sand, nails and other things to finish her home. It is important for her and her family to get these jobs done as soon as possible, as the rainy season has already begun in our country and they should be protected for the strong winter they will face.

loans.use: to improve her home

loans.name: Khadim

texts.fr: Monsieur Khadim est un homme célibataire et il vit au Sénégal. Son activité économique est la vente de pièces détachées. Il a acquis beaucoup d’expérience dans ce domaine car cela fait plus de 07 ans qu’il exerce cette activité. Il sollicite au niveau du  guichet  de  l’U-IMCEC où il est membre un prêt de 400.000 francs CFA  dans le but de développer son  activité. Il prévoit  d’acheter  avec son financement des pièces détachées pour  satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et  renforcer son activité. Il souhaite diversifier la gamme de pièces détachées qu’il propose à sa clientèle. L’augmentation de ses revenus lui donnera l’opportunité de rendre meilleur les conditions alimentaire de sa famille et de faire plus d’économie. Il souhaite devenir un homme très connu dans la vente de pièces détachées.
texts.en: Mister Khadim is a single man and he lives in Senegal. His business is the sale of spare parts. He has acquired a lot of experience in this domain since it has been more than 7 years that he has practiced this business. He is requesting a loan of 400,000 FCFA from the branch of the UIMCEC where he is a member with the goal of developing his business. With his financing he plans to buy spare parts to satisfy the demand of his customers and strengthen his business. He hopes to diversify the range of spare parts that he offers his customers. The increase in his revenue will give him the opportunity to improve the nutritional conditions of his family and to save more. He hopes to become a very well-known man in the sale of spare parts.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to resell.

loans.name: Sophornnavy

texts.en:
Sophornnavy is 30 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than ten years, earning approximately $7 daily. Her husband is a construction foreman who makes an income of $8 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sophornnavy is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce their transportation expenses and save some money to support the family. In the future, she would like purchase more construction tools for her husband to be able to bid for bigger construction project and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue was born in 1990. She has two children aged 5 and 3. Her husband and her are carpenters.  He earns about 5,000,000 VND and Hue earns about 3,500,000 VND per month. She has done this job for five years. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,500,000 VND per month. 

Hue's dream is to enlarge her carpentry workshop and raise her children well. However, her challenge is a lack of capital to invest in the workshop. This loan is one of the steps to help her achieve this dream. Hue is a hard-working and dynamic woman. Her family has a long tradition of doing carpentry and she loves this job. 

Hue has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2013. In this first loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 33-year-old married man from Gaza city. He is a father with three kids: two sons and one daughter. Mohammad works as an employee with a low salary.  At night he also works with a taxi he owns. He takes both internal and external requests to get a good income for his family and provide all their necessary needs. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to purchase a new engine for his taxi. This will increase the taxi capacity and also his income. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his taxi.

loans.name: Nimer

texts.en:
Nimer is a 38-year-old married man from Jenin city. He is a father with three sons and one daughter. He is a worker with a low salary which barely covers the family's needs. His salary is the only income for the family. 

He would like to complete his new home and live in it in a better condition. Nimer took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to paint and decorate his new home. 

Nimer appears in the photo in his new house.

loans.use: to pay the costs of paint and decorate the family's new house.

loans.name: Las Mariposas Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las   Mariposas está conformada por diez integrantes, madres solteras con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Estas mujeres son originarias del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Ellas se caracterizan por ser personas trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos, y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Por lo cual luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus pequeños hijos.
Danelia es la coordinadora del banco comunal Las Mariposas, y tiene por actividades económica  una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de shapoo, cajas de fósforos, cigarros por unidad, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergente,  verduras, tiste. Ella dedica a su actividad unas 12 horas diarias, ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en productos comestibles en   cantidades pequeñas, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  El banco comunal Las Mariposas agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Mariposas has ten members, single mothers responsible for 15 children. These women are from El Sauce in the northern part of the country. They are characterized by being hard-working, responsible, and eager to improve their situation. Unfortunately, they didn't get an opportunity to study because of lack of economic resources, and found themselves forced to work from an early age in order to help out with the expenses of the household. Therefore, they struggle every day to assure a better future for their children.

Daniela is the coordinator of the communal bank Las Mariposas, and runs a corner store in her home. In this little store she sells food products and consumer goods in small quantities such as shampoo, matches, cigars, rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, vegetables, and tiste [a drink made from corn]. She works about 12 hours daily in her store, selling her products. The purpose of the credit request is to invest in small quantities of food products, in order to increase her income in the near future. 

The communal bank Las Mariposas is grateful to Kiva lenders for the help they offer to people with scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can earn their living by means of decent work.

loans.use: to invest in her business and stock her store with products such as shampoo, matches, cigars, rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, vegetables, and tiste

loans.name: Marwa

texts.en:
Marwa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Marwa is a married woman from Jabalia city. She is a mother with three kids. Her husband works as an employee and gets a low salary. This is the only source of income to the family. 

She is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing a new TV and refrigerator in order to improve the living conditions in her house. Taking this loan will offer Marwa some nice appliances so she can better enjoy living in her house with her family.

loans.use: to buy a new TV and refrigerator.

loans.name: Fukraj

texts.en:
Fukraj is a 44-year-old married housewife who is living with her husband and two sons in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Since 2007 her husband has been running a shoe shop in the market while she herself sells shoes at home as well. Her elder son has completed graduation recently and she wants him to open a new shop in the future. 

Fukraj has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase more of a variety of shoes for the shop so that they can increase their sales and net income. She dreams of her children's bright future and desires to build her own house, as she is now living in a rented house with her family. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of shoes for reselling.

loans.name: Bajis

texts.en:
Bajis is a young Palestinian man from a small village near Hebron city called Beit-Awwah. His father is a worker with a low wage. This income barely covers the family's necessary costs. 

Bajis works with a small pickup car to transfer goods and products to the traders and he also buys used items to resell. He took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to develop his business by buying more products to resell. 

Bajis appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more used stuff to resell.

loans.name: Michael

texts.es: Michael es un señor de 42 años de edad, vive con dos de sus hijos, la vivienda d está severamente deteriorada, le faltan ventanas, corredor, cuarto de pilas,pisos y cambiar parte del techo, entre otras cosas. Ella necesita reparla antes de que lleguen las lluvias ya que el agua entra al interior de su hogar cada vez que llueve. Necesita un crédito de un millón de colones (¢1.000.000) para comprar zinc, cemento, piedra, madera y otros materiales. Obtener este crédito le hace sentir muy feliz.
texts.en:
Michael is 42 and lives with two of his children. His house is in extremely poor condition. Among other things, it needs windows, hallway, laundry room, floors, and part of the roof needs replacement. 

He needs to repair it before the rains come, as the water comes into the interior of his home every time it rains. He needs a loan of 1 million colons so that he can buy sheet metal roofing, cement, stone, wood and other materials. Obtaining this loan makes him feel very happy.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for his home.

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
El señor Celso esta casado con la Sra. Regina hace mas de 30 años tienen 4 hijos mayores de edad los cuales ya son profesionales, abogados, médicos, arquitectos.
El Sr. Celso es dueño de una metalúrgica que se dedica a la fabricación de maquinas industriales agrícola, es militar retirado. Se retiro para poder emprender su negocio que hasta la fecha sigue funcionando cada vez mejor, su principal trabajo es la fabricación de molinos de granos, forrajeras, amazadoras de pan entre otros. El comenta que gracias a su esfuerzo y el de su esposa, pudieron criar a sus hijos y hacer de ellos personas de bien.
El crédito que solicito es para la reparación del techo y algunos arreglos en el piso.  Su sueño es adquirir un terreno con una buena dimensión y acopiar hierros de todo tipo ya que Celso está convencido de que la venta de hierro es muy rentable.
texts.en:
Celso has been married to Regina for more than 30 years and they have four adult children with professional careers as lawyers, doctors, and architects.

Celso is the owner of a metal shop and makes industrial farm equipment.  He is retired from the military service and retired so that he could work his business that continues to function better and better.  His main work is making grain mills, fodder makers, dough makers, and other things.  He says that he and his wife were able to raise their children and make them persons of means, thanks to his and his wife’s efforts.

He is asking for this loan in order to repair his roof and some parts of the floor.  His dream is to acquire a good piece of land and pick up some pieces of iron, because Celso is convinced that iron sales is very profitable.

loans.use: to make repairs to the floor and roof.

loans.name: Betsaida Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es María Auxiliadora mujer de 56 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos, tiene 14 años de tener su negocio como es la venta de pollo y granos básicos, estos productos los comercializa en su domicilio en su comunidad, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de pollo, papel higiénicos, sopas maggi, jabón marfil, jabón prego, tang etc. Paula tiene 54 años de edad y su negocio es la crianza y venta de pollo y Aura tiene 52 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de comida.
texts.en:
This group has three members who are entrepreneurs. One of them is Maria Auxiliadora, who is a 56-year-old woman, and she is married with two children. She has run a business selling chicken and basic grains for 14 years. She sells these products from her home in the community. She will invest the loan in purchasing grains like rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, chicken, toilet paper, Maggi soups, Marfil soap, Prego soap, Tang, etc. 

Paula is  54 years old and has a business raising and selling chickens. Aura is 52 and has a business selling food.

loans.use: to purchase grains like rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, beef, chicken, toilet paper, Maggi soups, Marfil soap, Prego soap, Tang, etc.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 45 years old and lives in Tukuran ZDS. She is married with 2 children.

Felisa has a shop that sells cosmetics. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan to have extra capital for her business. She needs to buy additional inventories of perfume, face powder, lotion for more income.

Felisa has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future Felisa hopes to have a new business.

loans.use: to buy additional inventories of cosmetics for retail

location.town: Pagadian-Upper Bayao Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 30,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional materials like linen, thread, etc. for her tailoring business.

Lina has been in this business for 15 years. Lina earns more income from raising livestock and a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her tailoring and general store businesses.

Lina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like linen, thread, etc for her business

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
Sary, 58, is married and living with her family in a village of Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has five children. For the last twenty-five years, Sary and her husband have been farming rice on ten hectares of farmland as the main source of family’s income. Together, they can earn about 83,000 KHR per day from the current business and they can manage to save about 40,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Sary’s group consists of two members and she is a sixth-cycle client. The past loans which she successfully repaid have helped her support her family with sufficient food. Now requesting another loan with VisionFund, Sary, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her rice paddy business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Esther Wanja

texts.en:
Esther Wanja is happily married and a mother of five living in the Kiambu district in central Kenya.  Of Wanja's five children, two are in secondary school but the rest have dropped out of school due to lack of school fees.  Wanja and her husband rely on their one-acre piece of land where they practice dairy farming, raise poultry and also grow vegetables.  She makes about $175 US per month from the sale of milk, eggs and vegetables.  However, her monthly expenses are around $130 US when she totals the prices of charcoal, firewood, kerosene, and fertilizer for her vegetable garden.  

Wanja discovered from a friend that she could save up to $105 US per month by constructing a biogas plant in her home which she could then use for lighting and cooking.  Additionally, she can use the organic bioslurry produced by the biogas plant in place of the fertilizer to grow her vegetables.  She is requesting this loan to facilitate the construction of the biogas plant so that she can benefit from these savings.  She plans to repay the loan in 24 months from the earnings she will make selling milk, eggs and vegetables.

loans.use: To construct a biodigester

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma, 63, is married with 2 children. They in Sebac,Tudela. She has been a government employee for 20 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 8000. Norma has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. She is applying a loan of Php 30,000 to buy materials to repair her home. She hopes to live comfortably with a descent house.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials for repairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, horchata [a rice milk drink], bags, straws, etc.

loans.name: Maritza Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Maritza es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a sus 2 hijos. Su negocio es la  elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace 15 años.
Doña  Maritza  vende a diario  el mercado municipal.  está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de más materia prima como ser: maíz, cal y leña que necesita para seguir elaborando su producto. 
Doña  Maritza  espera gracias al préstamo poder contar con los insumos necesarios que le permitan continuar con su negocio y así seguir elaborando sus producto, además  de un aumento en sus ventas que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 
Doña  Maritza  espera en futuro hacer crecer su negocio y seguir apoyando a su familia y de esta manera que sus hijos continúen con los estudios y se conviertan en personas de bien y con mayores oportunidades en la vida.




Choluteca, Honduras – Abril 2013
texts.en:
Maritza is a very hard-working and responsible person.  She lives with her two children in a community in the southern part of Honduras.  She has had her business of making and selling tortillas for 15 years.

Maritza sells every day at the municipal market.  She is requesting the loan to buy more raw materials like corn, lime powder, and firewood that she needs to continue making her product.

Maritza hopes, thanks to the loan, to be able to have the supplies needed that will allow her to continue with her business.  This way she will continue making her products.  Additionally, she hopes to have an increase in sales that will allow her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

In the future Maritza  hopes to make her business grow and to continue supporting her family.  This way her children will continue their education and will become good people with greater life opportunities.

Choluteca, Honduras – April 2013

loans.use: to buy  corn, lime powder, and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To install a drip irrigation kit and buy tomato and onion seedlings for their garden

loans.name: Marenje Wire Group

texts.en:
This group was trained in 2011 by PENYA and was supported with a start up kit for wire making after they realized that local farmers were traveling long distances to buy wire for fencing their plots.  The business is doing well but the demand for their wire exceeds their supply capacity.  Their goal is to expand their business by supplying wire to farmers from the nearby wards for fencing purposes.

PENYA assists borrowers with entrepreneurial skills training through the Start and Improve Your Business (SIYB) Program.  PENYA also helps them form Village Savings and Loans Associations where they save proceeds from their businesses that will then become the future sources for additional loans and business investments.  Finally, PENYA carries out mentoring and monitoring visits to ensure that the businesses are being run viably.  Through linkages created with extension workers and some buyers, PENYA borrowers have access to further training in the production and selling of their produce.

loans.use: To purchase a wire runner, a second wire making machine, and protective items for the group

loans.name: Patrick And Roy Group

texts.en:
Patrick and Roy, aged 24 and 18, are brothers who lost their father due to an HIV-related illness.  They are now responsible for the care of their ailing mother and 3 other siblings.  They have been running a clothing and cleaning business for 2 years.  They make liquid detergents and toilet cleaners as well as sports uniforms such as t-shirts, tracksuits and hats.  In their business, they employ 3 other youths who assist in the production of goods. 

They plan to increase their manufacturing space and open a uniform distribution shop at the local business centre.  They are also working around entering into contracts to supply nearby boarding schools with cleaning agents as well as uniforms.

PENYA assists borrowers with entrepreneurial skills training through the Start and Improve Your Business (SIYB) Program.  PENYA also helps them form Village Savings and Loans Associations where they save proceeds from their businesses that will then become the future sources for additional loans and business investments.  Finally, PENYA carries out mentoring and monitoring visits to ensure that the businesses are being run viably.  Through linkages created with extension workers and some buyers, PENYA borrowers have access to further training in the production and selling of their produce.

loans.use: To purchase school uniform fabric and chemicals for cleaning agents.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abie is 34 years old and a mother of two (with the eldest in secondary school and at the top of his class).  She has been running an interior decor manufacturing business since 2002.  She was involved in a near fatal accident in December 2012 that left her hospitalised for 3 months and bed ridden for even longer.  The accident affected her business as she had to sell one of her machines to pay for her hospital fees.

Abie would like to use this loan to restock fabrics as well as replace the sewing machine she sold.  Her goals are to increase her sales revenue and open a shop outlet, as well as see her first child through university.

PENYA assists borrowers with entrepreneurial skills training through the Start and Improve Your Business (SIYB) Program.  PENYA also helps them form Village Savings and Loans Associations where they save proceeds from their businesses that will then become the future sources for additional loans and business investments.  Finally, PENYA carries out mentoring and monitoring visits to ensure that the businesses are being run viably.  Through linkages created with extension workers and some buyers, PENYA borrowers have access to further training in the production and selling of their produce.

loans.use: To buy curtain and duvet fabric and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Matapiri Group

texts.en:
After being trained by PENYA this group identified potato growing as the project they would like to venture into.  This group is made up of 7 energetic young men who are all self-employed and rely on farming to earn a living.  They plan to use the loan to increase their current potato crop hectarage and also put up a drip irrigation kit.  
Their goals are to increase the hectarage under potato crops to at least 5 hectares as they gain more knowledge and skill.

PENYA assists borrowers with entrepreneurial skills training through the Start and Improve Your Business (SIYB) Program.  PENYA also helps them form Village Savings and Loans Associations where they save proceeds from their businesses that will then become the future sources for additional loans and business investments.  Finally, PENYA carries out mentoring and monitoring visits to ensure that the businesses are being run viably.  Through linkages created with extension workers and some buyers, PENYA borrowers have access to further training in the production and selling of their produce.

loans.use: To install a drip irrigation kit and buy potato seedlings for 1 hectare

loans.name: Chipo

texts.en:
Chipo is 24 years old and is the eldest child in a family of 4.  She has been operating a grocery shop since 2010 after she was trained by PENYA in the Start and Improve Your Business (SIYB) Program.  Chipo lost her parents 5 years ago due to HIV-related diseases.  She is therefore looking after her siblings and has been paying for their school fees with the money she earns from her grocery shop.  At her shop, she is able to provide supplies to people from the surrounding villages who would have otherwise had to travel distances of more than 5 kilometers to the nearest business center. 

Chipo will use this loan to purchase stock for her shop in bulk.  She will purchase supplies such as sugar, salt, soap, school bags, plasticware and other general grocery supplies.  She also plans to expand her shopping space and build her own so she can stop renting the space she is currently using.  Finally, she can transform her store into a supermarket with a hardware section, which will stop villagers from travelling 60 kilometers to the nearest town to get seasonal supplies for the cropping season.

PENYA assists borrowers with entrepreneurial skills training through the Start and Improve Your Business (SIYB) Program.  PENYA also helps them form Village Savings and Loans Associations where they save proceeds from their businesses that will then become the future sources for additional loans and business investments.  Finally, PENYA carries out mentoring and monitoring visits to ensure that the businesses are being run viably.  Through linkages created with extension workers and some buyers, PENYA borrowers have access to further training in the production and selling of their produce.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, school bags, plasticware, soap and sugar in bulk for stocking her grocery stores

loans.name: Watyoka Ladies Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of six young mothers aged between 18 and 35.  They have been working together as a group since August 2011 when they were trained by PENYA in small business management.  Initially, these ladies wanted to start raising hens so that they could supply eggs.  However, due to the fact that the start up capital for this is quite high they decided to carry out a horticulture venture instead.  From the revenue generated, they will start to build their fowl runs for the egg production business.  In addition to expanding and venturing into egg production, they want to ensure each group member has a drip irrigation kit on thier individual plots within the next two cropping seasons. 

PENYA assists borrowers with entrepreneurial skills training through the Start and Improve Your Business (SIYB) Program.  PENYA also helps them form Village Savings and Loans Associations where they save proceeds from their businesses that will then become the future sources for additional loans and business investments.  Finally, PENYA carries out mentoring and monitoring visits to ensure that the businesses are being run viably.  Through linkages created with extension workers and some buyers, PENYA borrowers have access to further training in the production and selling of their produce.

loans.use: To install a drip irrigation kit and buy tomato and onion seedlings for their garden

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase seedlings and chemicals to plant 2 hectares of tobacco, and get a drip irrigation kit for their seedbed

loans.name: Tadii Youth Group

texts.en:
This group's members come from one village and are aged between 16 and 26.  A number of them dropped out of school due to financial challenges and have been living on wages from odd jobs for a long time.  After being trained by PENYA, the group identified organic gardening as the business they would like to venture into.  They have been doing well over the past year and have been supplying the local business centre with fresh vegetables.  Their goal is to further their training in organic farming and enter into a farming contract to supply local hotels.  They would also like to venture into oyster mushroom production.

PENYA assists borrowers with entrepreneurial skills training through the Start and Improve Your Business (SIYB) Program.  PENYA also helps them form Village Savings and Loans Associations where they save proceeds from their businesses that will then become the future sources for additional loans and business investments.  Finally, PENYA carries out mentoring and monitoring visits to ensure that the businesses are being run viably.  Through linkages created with extension workers and some buyers, PENYA borrowers have access to further training in the production and selling of their produce.

loans.use: To install a drip irrigation kit and buy tomato, onion and kale seedlings for their garden

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es: El Sr. Emiliano  sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de helados y con la venta de material reciclable, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra un motor para su moto, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de un frizer para mantener sus helados congelados, se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que está creciendo y mejorando su actividad.
texts.en: Emiliano is continuing in his business selling ice cream and selling recyclable materials.  He reports that his previous loan was helpful, since he used it to purchase a new motor for his motorcycle.  He is currently seeking a loan so that he can buy a freezer to store his ice cream.  He is happy and grateful for this loan opportunity, and his business is growing and improving.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 5 años su principal siembra es el maíz y el maicillo, vende sus productos en agencias de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo en casa propia, el cliente solicita un crédito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios para seguir con su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc. asi como muestra la fotografía y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
This borrower has been working as a farmer for the past five years.  His main crops are corn and sorghum.  He sells his products to distributors who are close to where he lives.  With his earnings he is able to meet his household expenses.  He lives with his common-law wife and his son in his own house.  

He is seeking a loan so that he can purchase the supplies he needs to continue with his farming activities, such as fertilizer, compost, seeds, herbicides and other items.  This will enable him to provide his family with greater financial stability.  He is shown working in the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, compost, seeds, herbicides and other items.

loans.name: Wenefreda

texts.en: Wenefreda is a 57-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two children, 16 and 20 years old. She engages in fishing. She sells fish and crabs. She has been engaged in fishing for almost 10 years. She applied for a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy materials for fishing, such as steel bars, nylon and screens (used in making crab cages). Wenefreda would like to expand her fishing business to earn a living and, at the same time, to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing, such as steel bars, nylon and screens ( used in making crab cages).

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is a 41-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest is 24, and the youngest is 12. She engages in fishing. She sells fish, crabs and sea shells. She has been engaged in fishing for more than 10 years. This is the family's source of income. She applied for a loan of 16,000 PHP to buy fishing materials, such as like fish nets, crab cages and weights, to increase the volume of her catch. In the future, Myrna hopes that she will be successful, in order to experience harmony in life and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials, such as fish nets, crab cages and weights.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: Emelita is a widowed woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Emelita is 48 years old and has two children who are in school. Emelita has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Emelita applied for a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy inputs, including meat, bamboo sticks and spices, for her food production business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now applying for a new loan to further build up her food-vending business. Emelita has been in this business for 28 years. In the future, Emelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy inputs, including meat, bamboo sticks and spices, for her food production business.

loans.name: Rahmat

texts.en: A kind man by the name of Rahmat lives in a flat which is in bad condition. He has been busy with a taxi service for more than four years. His wife is a seamstress. They have four clever children. Rahmat’s children want to live in a flat which is in good condition, but his income is not enough to accomplish this. He must repair all the rooms, bedroom, bathroom, living room and kitchen. He is applying for a loan of 3,000 TJS (Tajik somoni) to buy building materials. In this way, he will be able to offer his family a better quality of life, as well as moral stability that will allow them to progress. Each month he will make his payment on time. He awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing flat

loans.name: 1 De Abril Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “1 DE ABRIL” iniciará el décimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por doce  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Valeria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, fábrica de helado, tejido de guantes, elaboración de muebles, bordado de estandartes, venta de fruta, costura de chamarras, tejido de mantas, venta de material de escritorio, venta de mandiles, carpintería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Valeria es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de bordado; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con la ayuda de sus hijos, quienes le compraron el equipo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra tela) que adquirirá de las ferias, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el compromiso con las amigas.
texts.en:
The community bank “1 de Abril” is starting its tenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, through its regional office Panamericana.  The group is comprised of twelve members and is overseen by a board of directors, of which Valeria is the president.  The members are engaged in various business, such as: 

- Sewing and knitting of jackets, gloves and blankets

- Making decorative flags

- Furniture making

- Ice cream making

- The sale of fruits, clothing, aprons and stationary

This loan will benefit these small business owners, one of whom is Valeria.  She reports that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution.  Currently she has a sewing business.  It is worth noting that she learned this business with the help of her children, who purchased the equipment for her.

She will use the loan proceeds to purchase cloth, which she will obtain at markets at wholesale prices.  She will then sell her finished goods from her place of business.  This will enable her to generate income to support her household to the best of her ability.  She is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she appreciates the commitment of her friends in the group.

loans.use: to purchase cloth.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.pt:
De 27 anos de idade, seguranca vive maritalmente ha 02 anos na casa propria com sua familia, tem 01 filho ainda menor alem do filho sustenta seus pais que vivem com ele.
