To provide this new service, Aja is required to print out receipts for customers. A Kiva loan will help him purchase this printer, so he will be able to offer the new service.

loans.use: to purchase a printer for printing out required receipts for mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Decontee

texts.en:
Please meet 30-year-old Decontee from Paynesville North in Liberia. Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County.  The area is home to “round time marketers”, traders that travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county. As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia. 

Decontee completed twelfth grade and is married. Her spouse is a driver. She describes herself as business-minded. She has three children between the ages of 14 years and 5 months old.  Only two are in school, and they all live at home. 

Decontee has a shop that sells soft drinks, milk, sugar, etc. She has been in business for six years and works nine hours per day at her business. She will use the loan to buy more inventory. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is the rainy season. She transports her goods by taxi. 

She started her business with money from her fiancée. She is proud of her business because she gets more profit. Her plan is to own a house. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy more inventory.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: La Sra. Angelica tiene 44 años,  tiene tres hijos de las edades de 16, 13 y 7 años, que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa según la temporada,  en su puesto de venta que se encuentran en la zona Central,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Angelica va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor como chompas y chamarras  para surtir su negocio ya que se acerca la época de frio, y esta época tiene mucha venta e incluso pedidos , su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, la Sra. Angelica enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria, va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar un equipo de sonido y un televisor y también seguir mejorando su puesto de venta, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, la Sra. Angelica se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que le permite mejorar en su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Angelica is 44 years old and has three school-aged children who are 7, 13, and 16 years old.  She works selling seasonal clothing at her sales post in the Central area.

This is her first loan with the institution.  Angelica will use this loan to purchase wholesale clothing such as sweaters and jackets in order to stock her business since the cold season is coming and she has many sales and orders.  She is requesting this loan because she lacks capital.  Angelica is facing challenges at her business, including daily competition.  She will use the benefits from the loan to purchase a stereo and television and also to continue improving her sales post.  

She hopes that her business will be stocked with merchandise in order to offer her customers a variety of products.  Angelica is happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided since it allows her to improve her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es: Sandra del Carmen, mayor de edad casada con dos hijos menores de edad, originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, Sandra es trabajadora activa en un centro de educación, cuenta con su salario como docente, ella poco  a poco ha ido mejorando sus vivienda, con los créditos que ha obtenido para así brindarle un lugar digno donde vivir a sus hijos, uno de sus sueños y metas es poder terminar de construir su casa y el ver culminado sus estudios a sus hijos siendo unos profesionales, Sandra solicita financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción como; Zin, Perlines, hierro, clavos,  cerámica, cal, entre otros, ya su objetivo es reparar el techo de su vivienda y colocarle cerámica, debido a que con estas lluvias cercas no desea mojarse ni que su familia se enferme.
texts.en:
Sandra del Carmen is married and has two young children.  She is originally from the town of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country.  Sandra works at a school as a teacher.  Little by little, she has been making improvements to her home.  Thanks to the loans she has obtained, she has provided a decent place for her children to live.  Her goals are to finish building her house and see her children finish school and become professionals.  

Sandra is requesting this loan to purchase construction materials such as zinc sheeting, beams, iron, nails, tiles, lime, and other items.  Her goal is to repair the roof of her home and tile it so that the coming rains will not get her home wet and her family will not get sick.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as zinc sheeting, beams, cement, iron, nails, and tiles.

loans.name: Ciro

texts.es: Ciro de 42 años es un hombre trabajador, vive en compañía de su esposa Doris con quien tiene 2 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 17 años.Sus días son agotadores, él trabaja para una compañía de agua por lo que le pagan el servicio de trasporte al mes. Afirma que gusta mucho de este trabajo pues es más tranquilo, en anteriores trabajos era independiente y trasportaba mercadería a distintas ciudades del país. Ahora que tiene este contrato se siente bien. “El contrato es con toda la camioneta, ellos me pagan dos sueldos, por mi camioneta y mi servicio de chofer, es rentable y no me traslado a otras ciudades”, afirma. Es así que espera ahorrar lo necesario para poner el negocio de engrase y lavado de carros, pues su casa se ubica en un lugar céntrico.Este es el primer crédito con KIVA, agradece el apoyo recibido, ya que le ayuda a progresar en su negocio además se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Ciro, invertirá el dinero en la reparación y mantenimiento de su auto para así seguir trabajando con tranquilidad.
texts.en: 42-year-old Ciro is a hard-working man. He lives with his wife Doris, with whom he has two children. He looks after his children in the house he acquired 17 years ago. His days are exhausting - he works with a water company and gets paid for his transportation services on a monthly basis. He reports that he greatly enjoys this work, because it's quieter. In his previous occupations he was self-employed and used to transport merchandise to different cities of the country. Now that he has this contract, he feels good. "The whole van is under contract. They pay me two wages, one for my van and one for my driving services. It's profitable and I don't travel to other cities", he says. That's how he hopes to save enough money in order to start a business greasing and washing cars, since his house is in a central location. This is his first Kiva loan. He gives thanks for the support he's received, since it helps him to move his business forward. In addition, he pledges to make his repaments in a timely fashion. Ciro will use the money to do maintenance and repair work on his car so that he can continue to work with peace of mind.

loans.use: to do maintenance and repair work on his vehicle.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 5 hijos de 19, 17, 16, 5 y 4 años de edad los 3 mayores estudian actualmente, el se dedica a la agricultura  su principal siembra es el maíz y el frijol desde hace varios años cuando sus cultivos ya están lito los almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarla en los mercados de compra-venta de granos básicos con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Santiago solicita un credito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios como fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, entre otras cosas para tener buenas cosechas y asi el pueda obtener  mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Santiago is 37 and lives in his own house with his wife and his five children, ages 19, 17, 16, 5 and 4. The three eldest currently go to school. He has been farming for several years, and his main crops are corn and beans. 

When his crops are ready he stores them in the bins that are shown in the photo, so that later he can go and sell them in the markets where staple grains are bought and sold. 

With the earnings he gets from his sales, he manages to pay his household expenses. Santiago is requesting a loan so that he can buy the supplies he needs, such as fertilizers, herbicides, manures, and other things, so that he can have a good harvests and this way obtain better profits, in order to provide his family with better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, herbicides, manures, etc.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Don Gilberto vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, Él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de cómo ganarse la vida. Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive, las cuales son muy humildes no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia. Ha tomado la decisión de acercarse a esta institución para solicitar un crédito para comprar los principales insumos agrícolas como: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, etc. asi como muestra la fotografia. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
Don Gilberto lives in his own home with his wife and four children. He cultivates corn and beans. This is the way he makes a living and is able to put bread on the table everyday. He has farmed year after year and this is the only way he knows of making a living. He is a very hardworking, honest and responsible man. Despite his humble living conditions he never tires of working to provide the best for his family. 

He has decided to approach Apoyo Integral to apply for a loan in order to purchase initial agricultural supplies, such as fertilizer, insecticides, seeds, etc., as shown in the photo. He hopes to have good results since he has no other source of income. He has faith in God that he will succeed in having an abundant harvest, which will enable him to continue putting bread on the table everyday

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticides, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Janneh

texts.en:
Janneh is 28 years old, single, and lives in Gbarnga, in Liberia. Gbarnga is located in the centre of Liberia, in Bong County. The majority of people are employed as farmers, cultivating crops such as rice, palm oil and cassava.
  
Janneh has had a cooking shop for some time, and she sells rice and soup.  She works at her business 10 hours per day.  She transports goods to her business by taxi. The biggest challenge she faces in her business is running low on food ingredients, in her stock. With the proceeds from the loan, she wants to buy food ingredients for inventory.  

She describes herself as a hardworking woman.  She started her business with money from her mother. She went to school and finished grade 12. She has two children, aged 11 and 4 years, who are living at home and in school.  In the future, she wants to own a house.  Janneh is proud of her business, because she gets money every day for her expenses.  She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for inventory.

loans.name: Clelia Argentina

texts.es: Clelia Argentina, de 53 años de edad casada con tres hijos mayores de edad, del domicilio de Chinandega, zona que se caracteriza  por ser productivo el la comercialización, La señora Clelia es propietaria de un negocio de mercadería en general, como es compra venta de ropa de niños, adultos, cosméticos, chineria, entre otros, ella vende de manera ambulante y en posee una vitrina en su casa de habitación, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales los cuales recupera semanal y quincenal ella compra en mercados, los cuales la mayor parte son pedidos por sus clientes, el objetivo de este crédito es para capital de trabajo en la compra de mercadería general, ya su demanda a incrementado, Clelia inicia su negocio con dinero propio, uno de sus sueños es poder instalar una tienda en su casa de habitación.
texts.en: Clelia Argentina is 53 years old. She's married and has three adult children. She comes from the town of Chinandega, an area known for being fruitful for trading. Clelia owns a business buying and selling general merchandise such as clothing for children and adults, cosmetics, crafts, etc. She sells door-to-door and also has a display case in her house. She has regular and occasional customers and collects payments on a weekly and biweekly basis. She buys from markets, mostly by order from her customers. The goal of this loan is to get working capital for purchasing general merchandise, since her demand has increased. Clelia started her business using her own money. One of dreams is to be able to set up a store in her home.

loans.use: to get working capital for purchasing general merchandise: clothing for children and adults, cosmetics, crafts, etc.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
Fanta is 30 years old, married, and lives in Gbarnga, in Liberia. Gbarnga is located in the centre of Liberia, in Bong County. The majority of people are employed as farmers, cultivating crops such as rice, palm oil and cassava.
 
Fanta has had a sales table for some time, and she sells palm oil.  She works at her business 8 hours each day.  She transports her goods to her business by bus. The biggest challenge she faces in her business is having too few goods on hand (in stock).  With the proceeds from the loan, she wants to buy more palm oil to sell.

She went to school and finished grade 12.  Her husband is a teacher.  She has a nine-year-old child at home, who is in school.  Fanta describes herself as a hardworking woman.  She started her business with money from her mother. In the future, she wants to own a house.  She is proud of her business, because she earns money every day, for her expenses.  Fanta wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Ameamata

texts.en:
Ameamata is 50 years old, single, and lives in Nimba County, in Liberia.  Nimba is one of the most resource-rich areas in Liberia, producing minerals such as iron ore.  The county shares a border with both Cote D’Ivoire and Guinea.  As a result, many people on business pass through the area, bringing lots of trade.  It is also the second most populous area in Liberia.
 
Ameamata has had a shop for some time, where she sells clothes.  She works at her business nine hours per day.  She transports her goods to her business by bus. The biggest challenge she faces in her business is having too few goods in her shop.  With the proceeds from the loan, she wants to increase her inventory.

She went to school and finished grade 12.  Her fiancee is a wood seller.  She has a 27-year-old child.  Ameamata describes herself as a hardworking woman.  She started her business with money from her mother. In the future, she wants to own a house.  She is proud of her business, because she earns money every day, for her expenses.  She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Precelia

texts.en:
Precelia is 34 years old, single, and lives in Nimba County, in Liberia.  Nimba is one of the most resource-rich areas in Liberia, producing minerals such as iron ore.  The county shares a border with both Cote D’Ivoire and Guinea.  As a result, many people on business pass through the area, bringing lots of trade.  It is also the second most populous area in Liberia.
 
Precelia has had a shop for some time past, where she sells rubber dishes such as plates, cups, and bowls.  She works at her business 10 hours per day.  She transports her goods to her business by bus. The biggest challenge she faces in her business is having too few goods in her shop.  With the proceeds from the loan, she wants to buy more inventory.

She went to school and finished grade 12.  Her fiancee is a wood seller.  She has six children, aged between 6 and 17 years.  She describes herself as a hardworking woman.  She started her business with money from her mother. In the future, she wants to own a house.  Precelia is proud of her business, because she earns money every day, for her expenses.  She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар 43-х летняя замужняя женщина. Она заботливая мать, у нее трое детей. Дилбар с мужем, сыном и дочерьми проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ее семья очень деятельная, каждый занят своим делом. Её муж работает шофером. Он развозит пассажиров по нужному маршруту, а её старший сын находится в России на заработках. Старшая дочь замужем и живет отдельно, а младшая дочь занимается вышиванием национальных платьев. Дилбар имеет среднее образование. Она тоже занимается собственным видом деятельности. Дилбар вышивает национальное узкое стёганое одеяло (курпача). Она в этой области работает на протяжении двух лет. Кроме этого она еще занимается и растениеводством. Дилбар берет кредит для приобретения ниток и тканей для шитья. В дальнейшем она хочет расширить бизнес и купить швейную машинку за счет дохода от деятельности.
texts.en: Dilbar is a 43-year old married woman. She is a caring mother of three. Dilbar lives in the town of Tursun-zoda together with her husband, son and daughters. Her family is very hard-working: all have their own work to take care of. Her husband works as a driver. He transports passengers upon request. Her oldest son is now in Russia as a migrant worker. The oldest daughter is married and lives separately, and the youngest daughter embroiders traditional dresses. Dilbar has secondary education. She also has a business of her own. She embroiders traditional narrow patchwork quilted blankets (“kurpacha”). She has been in this business for over two years. In addition, she also grows produce. Dilbar is taking out a loan to buy thread and fabric for sewing. In the future she would like to expand her business and buy a sewing machine thanks to her revenues.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabric.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 42 years old, single, and lives in Nimba County, in Liberia.  Nimba is one of the most resource-rich areas in Liberia, producing minerals such as iron ore.  The county shares a border with both Cote D’Ivoire and Guinea.  As a result, many people on business pass through the area, bringing lots of trade.  It is also the second most populous area in Liberia.

Esther has had a sales table for some time, where she sells dried fish.  She works at her business 10 hours per day.  She transports her goods to her business by bus. The biggest challenge she faces in her business is having too few goods available to sell.  With the proceeds from the loan, she wants to increase her inventory.

She went to school and finished grade 12.  Her fiancee is a wood seller.  She has six children, aged between 8 and 21 years. Only two of the children are in school.  Esther describes herself as a hardworking woman.  She started her business with money from her mother. In the future, she wants to own a house.  She is proud of her business, because she earns money every day, for her expenses.  She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to increase her inventory by buying more dried fish

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 44 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, tiene mucha creatividad laboral y siempre va en busca de nuevos retos para salir adelante. Esta casada con Carlos quien se dedica a la construcción civil  y es padre de sus 2 hijos. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa.La actividad que realiza Elizabeth es la venta de ropa como polos, blusas, pantalones y vestidos en diversos modelos, tallas y colores además de accesorios femeninos tales como billeteras, carteras , entre otros. Ha establecido su local de ventas en un espacio de su casa hasta donde acude su clientela, ahí exhibe toda su mercadería en completo orden ya que se encuentran ubicados en vitrinas o maniquíes para una mejor visión de las mismas. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y familiares quienes le compran al crédito o al contado. Lleva en este negocio 6 años y por fortuna le va muy bien.Lo que le gusta de su actividad son los viajes que realiza a otras ciudades en donde compra su mercadería, le agrada escoger ella misma las prendas que luego ofrecerá a sus clientes porque sabe que se sentirán contentos con los modelos que obtiene y con la calidad de los productos que tendrán en sus manos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800 soles, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.Con el monto solicitado comprará ropa conformada por blusas y pantalones para damas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 44 years old and is a hardworking and enterprising woman.  She is very creative and always in search of new challenges to get ahead.  She is married to Carlos, who works in civic construction, and who is the father of her two children.  The all live comfortably in their home.  Elizabeth sells clothing such as polo shirts, blouses, pants, and dresses of different styles, sizes, and colors, and also ladies' accessories such as wallets, purses, and other things.  She has set up in an area of her home where her customers go.  She shows all her merchandise there in display cases or on mannequins so they show better.

Her main customers are her neighbors and family who buy for cash and credit.  She has been doing this for six years and fortunately things are going well for her.  What she enjoys about her business are the trips she makes to other cities where she buys her merchandise.  She enjoys choosing the clothing that she will later offer to her customers because she knows they will be happy with the styles and quality of her products.  She is asking for 800 PEN and she is very grateful to know that she has financial support and can feel confident in moving her business ahead.  She is also committed to making h payments on time.  She will use the money to buy clothing such as women's blouses and pants.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Julia Mercedes

texts.es: Julia Mercedes 50 años de edad casada con tres hijos, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, Julia es una mujer emprendedora, que logrado sacar adelante a su familia, se dedica a la compra y venta de mercadería en general como: ropa de niños y adultos, cosméticos, chinerías, prendas de oros, plata, entre otros, sus compras las realiza en mercados de mayoreos al contado, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito las cuales las recupera quincenal y semanal, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales ella vende sus productos a trabajadores de los ingenios los cuales se han hecho buenos clientes de ella y sus pedidos ha incrementado, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo como: compra de pantalones, ropa interior, zapatos, cosméticos entre otros. Julia está muy agradecida con los inversionistas Kivas por el apoyo que ellos les ofrece a personas de bajo recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Julia Mercedes is 50 years old, married and has three children. She is from one of the municipalities of Chinandega, in the west of the country.

Julia is an enterprising woman who has succeeded in moving her family forward. She works buying and selling general merchandise like: children's and adults clothing, cosmetics, chinoiserie, gold and silver jewelry among others. She buys in cash from wholesale markets, she makes cash and credit sales, and collects fortnightly and weekly. She has fixed and temporary customers and she sells her products to workers at the mills who have become good customers of hers and their orders have increased. 

The purpose of this loan is to invest in capital like: buying trousers, undergarments, shoes, cosmetics among others. Julia is very grateful to the Kiva investors for the support they offer to people with limited financial resources.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in general, children's and adult's clothing, chinoiserie, cosmetics, gold jewelry, among others.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Don Santiago de 43 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 25 años su principal siembra es el ajonjolí y el arroz, cuando sus cosechas ya están listas las vende en las agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos con las ganancias que obtiene  de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 13, 9 y 7 años de edad quienes estudian actualmente, don Santiago esta solicitando un crédito para poder comparar los insumos necesarios para su cosechas como: abonos, herbicidas, fertilizantes, etc. asi como muestra la fotografía para poder obtener mejores cosechas y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Santiago, who is 43 years old, has earned his living in agriculture for 25 years. His principal crops are sesame and rice. When his harvests are ready, he sells them to grain dealers. With the profits he makes from his sales, he is able to cover his household costs. He lives in his own house with his wife and his three children, who are 13, 9, and 7 years old and are currently in school. 

Santiago is requesting a loan to be able to buy the necessary supplies for his crops like soil amendments, herbicides, and fertilizers—like those shown in the photo—to be able to obtain better harvests, and to be able to give his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, herbicides, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna de 52 años de edad, vive con su esposo Pedro. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero solo vive con uno de ellos, 
en su casa propia.Desde hace 30 años se dedica al negocio de venta de verduras por eso todos los dias se despierta muy temprano para comprar verduras en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad para  luego venderlas al por menor, gracias a este negocio obtiene ganancias liquidas ya que el negocio es muy rentable y no tiene mucha  competencia, además ya tiene clientes conocidos. Además de vender sus propios sembríos de papa, habas y hortalizas,los cuales cosecha en cada temporada , también se dedica a la crianza de 11 vacas con los cuales elabora queso, un promedio de 7 a 6 moldes diarios. También a la crianza de 18 carneros los cuales engorda y lleva a venderlos a los carniceros y pobladores de su localidad.Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA y se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Reyna, invertirá los S/.2500 soles en la compra de verduras para su negocio.
texts.en:
52-year-old Reyna lives with her husband Pedro in her own house. They have eight children, but only one lives with them. For thirty years she has made a living from selling vegetables. For this reason she gets up very early in order to buy vegetables in the wholesale market of her city to sell at retail prices later. Thanks to this business she obtains net profits since the business is very profitable, does not have much competition, and already has a solid client base.

Besides selling her own potatoes, broad beans, and vegetables, which she harvests each season, she also makes cheese with the milk from the eleven cows she looks after. She makes an average of seven or six moulds every day. She also has eighteen rams which she fattens up and then sells to local butchers and inhabitants. This is her fourth loan with Kiva and she promises to be punctual with her repayments. Reyna will invest the 2500 PEN in purchasing vegetables for her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for her business

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a hardworking mother of three children. Her little daughter Ani studies at Goris State University, where she specializes in the department of pedagogy. The whole family works hard to cover their daily costs, and it is very difficult to save money for Ani's education.

So, by applying for this loan, Aida wants to pay for her daughter’s university tuition. This will enable Ani to complete her education, get a bachelor's degree, and achieve her goals. She dreams of becoming a teacher with a stable monthly income, and financially supporting her family. 

The whole family waits for your support.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Gloria Argentina

texts.es: Gloria Argentina de 37 años de edad casada, originaria de Chinandega ubicada en el occidente del país, ella es una mujer trabajadora, responsable, que ha tenido que salir adelante con muchos esfuerzos ya que  viene de una familia muy sencilla y pobre por lo que  no termino sus estudios, con lo poco que ella aprendió logra poner un taller de costura donde elabora costuras en general para damas, caballeros, y niños, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, Gloria desde hace más de un año ha deseado reparar su vivienda, el objetivo de este crédito es para construir una pared que se está deteriorando y cambiar el techo en un cuarto pero por falta de recursos económicos no lo había realizado, uno de sus sueños es terminar de construir sus vivienda, ella está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de zin, hierro, bloques, cemento, cal, arena entre otros materiales de construcción.-
texts.en:
Gloria Argentina is 37 years old and married. She is from Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country. She is a hard-working and responsible woman who has had to put a lot of effort in to get ahead as she comes from a very common and poor family, which means she could not finish her studies. With the little that she learnt she succeeded in setting up a sewing workshop where she makes garments for women, men, and children. She has regular clients and occasional clients. 

Gloria has wanted to repair her home for more than a year. This loan will be used to rebuild a wall which is deteriorating and to change the roof in one of the rooms. She has not been able to do this yet due to a lack of economic resources. One of her dreams is to finish building her home. She is requesting financing in order to buy corrugated galvanised iron, iron, cinder blocks, cement, lime, sand, and other construction materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as iron, corrugated galvanised iron, lime, cement, sand, and cinder blocks

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 29 years old, single, and lives in Gbarnga in Liberia. Gbarnga is located in the center of Liberia in Bong County. The majority of people are employed as farmers cultivating crops such as rice, palm oil, and cassava.  

She has run a general shop for the past two years and sells rice by the bag and cosmetics. She works at her business 9 hours a day.  She transports her goods to her business by bus. The biggest challenge she faces in her business is not enough goods in her shop. She went to school and finished grade 12. Her fiancee is a teacher. She has a nine-year-old child at home and in school.  

With the proceeds from the loan, she wants to buy more inventory for the store. She describes herself as a hard-working woman.  She started her business with money from her mother. In the future, she wants to own a house. She is proud of her business because she gets money every day for her expenses.

She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Matta

texts.en:
Matta is 44 years old, married, and lives in Gbarnga in Liberia. Gbarnga is located in the centre of Liberia in Bong County. The majority of people are employed as farmers cultivating crops such as rice, palm oil and cassava.  

She has run a business for the past four years and sells rice, oil, pepper, etc. from a table.  She works at her business 9 hours a day.  She transports her goods to her business by bus. The biggest challenge she faces in her business is not enough goods on her table.  She went to school and finished grade 12.  Her husband is a teacher.  She has a nine-year-old child at home and in school.  

With the proceeds from the loan she wants to buy more inventory.  She describes herself as a hard-working woman.  She started her business with money from her mother. In the future, she wants to own a house.  She is proud of her business because she gets money every day for her expenses.
  
She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 38 years old, married, and lives in Nimba County in Liberia.  Nimba is one of the most resource rich areas in Liberia, producing minerals such as iron ore. The county shares a border with both Cote D’Ivorie and Guinea.  As a result, many people on business pass through the area bringing lots of trade. It is also the second more populous area in Liberia. 

She has had a table business for the past five years and sells fish. She works at her business 10 hours a day. She transports her goods to her business by bus. The biggest challenge she faces in her business is not enough goods in her shop. She went to school and finished grade 12. Her husband is a wood seller. She has four children between 14 and 2 years old.  

With the proceeds from the loan she wants to buy more inventory.  She describes herself as a hard-working woman.  She started her business with money from her mother. In the future, she wants to own a house.  She is proud of her business because she gets money every day for her expenses.

She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more inventory

loans.name: Nyamah

texts.en:
Nyamah is 25 years old, single, and lives in Gbarnga in Liberia. Gbarnga is located in the center of Liberia in Bong County. The majority of people are employed as farmers cultivating crops such as rice, palm oil, and cassava.  

She has a table business for the past four years and sells clothes.  She works at her business 9 hours a day. She transports her goods to her business by taxi. The biggest challenge she faces in her business is not enough goods on her table.  She went to school and finished grade 12. She has a seven-year-old child at home and in school.  

With the proceeds from the loan she wants to buy more inventory.  She describes herself as a hard-working woman.  She started her business with money from her mother. In the future, she wants to own a house.  She is proud of her business because she gets money every day for her expenses.  

She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more inventory

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is 43 years old, single, and is living in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Gideon operates his own farm planting and harvesting vegetables for sale.

He has been doing this business for five years, earning three thousand a month. After joining GDMPC in 2012, he gained access to microfinance services and is now requesting an amount of 7,000 PHP to purchase seedlings and fertilizer such as manure. 

He wants to make improvements to his garden to have additional income for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase seedling and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee un negocio en el que comercializa gas propano en su casa de habitación, gracias a este trabajo es como ella  puede cubrir los gastos que tiene en su hogar, Maria recibe llamadas de teléfono solicitando sus servicios, por lo que Maria lleva los cilindros de gas hasta la casa de sus clientes y así mismo vende otros desde su casa. Maria con todo el deseo de hacer crecer su negocio solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL por medio del cual pueda invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de cilindros de gas, con lo que ella podrá atender más personas y así obtener más ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Maria, 37, lives in her own house with her husband and their two children.  She runs a business out of her home selling propane gas; and thanks to her work she is able to cover the household expenses.  Maria receives phone calls requesting her services and then delivers the gas cylinders to her customers.  She also sells directly from home.

With the desire of expanding her business, Maria is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL so she can buy more gas cylinders.  This will allow her to attend to more customers and earn a greater profit to give her family better economic stability.

loans.use: To buy more gas cylinders.

loans.name: Arcenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 60 years old and married with eight children.

Arsenia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, sugar, canned goods, and other supplies to sell in her general store.

Arsenia has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Arsenia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, sugar, canned goods, and other supplies to sell in her general store

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia is 63 years old, married, and has eleven children. 

Basilia is in the agricultural business, specifically hog raising, in the Philippines. Basilia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs.

Basilia has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Basilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Kimyet

texts.en: Kimyet is 34 years old. She is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in the garment factory for more than four years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a construction foreman who makes an income of $10 each day. Due to his lack of construction tools, Kimyet is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a mortar for her husband to use in his work. This purchase will help him work smoothly and faster. In the future, she would like expand the construction business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. In addition, she is planning to build a new house shortly.

loans.use: to purchase a mortar for her husband to use in his work

loans.name: Humberto Enrique

texts.es: Humberto de 35 años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos en casa propia, el se dedica a la producción y venta de toallas de franela tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles. Humberto quiere realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar la franela, hilos y todo los necesario para su negocio, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Humberto, 35, lives with his common-law wife and their three children in their own house.  He makes and sells flannel towels and has been in business for several years.  This has given him a  vast experience that enables him to earn a better profit.  He has a large customer base because people know about the quality and low prices of his products.

Humberto wants to make a new investment but does not have enough capital to do so.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan to buy flannel, thread and other supplies for his business.  He is committed to paying back the loan and hopes to be able to give his household economic security.

loans.use: To buy flannel, thread and other supplies.

loans.name: Ma. Clarita

texts.en:
Ma. Clarita works hard to support her family. Ma. Clarita is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Clarita requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Ma. Clarita has been in this business for 10 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Ma. Clarita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family as well as to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Martin Lenine

texts.es: Martín de treinta y ocho años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. El posee una venta de módulos, roperos, gabeteros, etc. y  otras obras de madera es muy conocido por la zona pues su trabajo es de excelente calidad y sobre todo a muy buen precio, se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente y no quiere decepcionar los quiere abastecer mas su negocio con los muebles de madera que realiza, Martín es un hombre de visión a futuro su mayor pasatiempo es trabajar. El sabe que tiene un don  y quiere aprovecharlo es  por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar todos los materiales necesarios para la elaboración de los muebles, Martín tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Martín, 38, lives with his common-law wife and their children in their own house.  He runs a business selling wood furniture and modules.  He is very well-known in the area for his excellent quality and very good prices.  Lately, he has attracted more customers and does not want to disappoint them by not being in a position to supply the wood furniture he makes.

Martín is a man with a vision for the future and, even in his free time, enjoys working.  He knows that he has a gift and wants to take advantage of it.  Therefore he is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to buy all the materials he needs to make his furniture.  He hopes this will allow him to provide economic security and a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To buy wood wholesale.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 59 years old and married to a farmer. The couple is blessed with three children. To help her husband supplement the needs of her family, Marilyn engages in managing a sari-sari (variety) store. She has been in the business for 20 years now. 

Through the business she is generating a net income of PHP500 daily which is essential in supporting their daily food intake. As part of her business development, Marilyn wants to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP18,000 to purchase additional commodities such as canned goods, breads, and beverages. She is hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can utilize it immediately in her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional commodities such as canned goods, breads, and beverages

loans.name: Erdenebulgan

texts.en:
Mr. Erdenebulgan, 42 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a rental apartment. He has been running a cafe since 2003 and in 2008, he began renting his cafe. In 2012, he purchased land and began building a house. He wants to rent out this house's rooms to people who are in urgent need of shelter. The house is almost completed but some interior work is remaining. So he is requesting a loan of 7000000 MNT to purchase building materials such as floor cloth, wallpapers, vacuum insulated windows, and fiberglass. 

If he completes and insulates his house, he can begin renting out its rooms and generate more income for his family as his three children are growing bigger each day and their needs are increasing. Also, building a high quality house will enable its renters to burn less coal, emit less smoke and then contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who wants to improve his family's living standard as well as to create a comfortable living space for his renters.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is a 33-year-old woman and is married with two children. She lives in Tabid, Ozamiz City. She owns and operates her business raising pigs for sale to earn la living. She's been doing this business for two years in order to support her husband. She recently requested an amount of 6,000.00 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to purchase piglets to raise. She wants to renovate the livestock's shelter in order to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de sus dos hijos logran solventar los gastos de sus hogar. La clienta solicita un crédito para comprar maíz por quintales para seguir elaborando las tortillas y así obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en:
The borrower lives in her own home with her two children and common-law husband.  For several years she has been selling tortillas from home and works Monday through Sunday.  She has many customers because of her kindness and hard work.  With the profits she earns and help from her children she is able to cover household expenses.  

The borrower is requesting a loan to buy corn in bulk so she can continue making tortillas and earn more income, thus giving her family better economic stability.

loans.use: To buy corn in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Evangelina

texts.es: María Evangelina se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, ganchos para el cabello, ropa interior para damas y caballeros,  entre otras cosas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en la salida del pasaje donde reside, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar vive en casa de su hija mayor, la clienta desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario como: perfumes, esmaltes para uñas, desodorantes y también desea comprar ropa ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles con la ayuda solicitada ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y así seguirá dándole a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
María Evangelina sells all kinds of personal products, such as lotions, deodorants, hair pins, women's and men's underwear, etc.  Her business is located at the end of the road where she lives.  With the profits she earns from sales and help from her husband, she is able to cover household expenses.  She lives with her eldest daughter.

The borrower wants to expand her business and has therefore requested a loan to buy everything she needs, such as perfumes, nail polish, deodorants and clothing.  She has many customers because of her low prices.  With the loan she is hoping to earn more income and continue giving her family everything they need.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, nail polish, deodorant, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Santos Leonor

texts.es: Doña Santos vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella tiene un puesto de pupusas en  su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Es una mujer luchadora que su empeño es dar lo mejor de si misma, para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para la subsistencia. Cuenta con la satisfacción de tener clientela fija ya que esta ubicado en un lugar muy transitado. Doña santos desea terminar una fosa séptica en su vivienda para poder construir el baño pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, por eso esta solicitando un crédito que le ermita comprar cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para poder terminar el trabajo y poder construir el baño.
texts.en: Santos lives in her own house with her three children.  She has a stand at her home where she sells "pupusas" (tortillas stuffed with cheese and meat or beans).  She has been doing this work for a number of years and the profits she earns have allowed her to cover household costs.  Santos is feisty and determined to provide the best for herself and her family - she does not want the family to go without.  Santos is satisfied knowing that she has regular customers, as she is in an area that has many passers-by.  Santos want to finish building the septic tank in her hope so that she can install a bathroom.  However, she does not have a high enough income to invest in this work and is therefore applying for a loan that will allow her to buy cement and sand and to pay for labourers to finish the work and build the bathroom.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand and to pay for labourers.

loans.name: Coralia

texts.es: Coralia es una mujer microempresaria emprendedora, de 38 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos menores de edad a su cargo, tiene un taller de costura y bordados desde hace 9 años consecutivos,fabrica camisas, cotonas, camisas guayaberas con bordados etc estos productos los comercializa en los municipios y departamentos del país como Catarina, Granada y Matagalpa, tiene cuatro años de ser cliente de la institución consecutivos muy responsables en sus pagos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como 20 yardas de tela de Dacron, 3 rollos de crochetes, 3 rollos de crochet clia, conos de hilos, tres cono cola ratón, 1 gruesa de elásticos, 45 yardas manta hindú etc.
texts.en: Coralia is an enterprising entrepreneur.  She is 38 years old, married and has two children, both under the age of 18, in her care.  Coralia has had a dressmaking and embroidery workshop for nine years.  She makes shirts, cotton shirts, guayabera shirts with embroidery and more.  She sells these products in the country's towns and departments, in places such as Catarina, Granada and Matagalpa.  Coralia has been a member of the communal bank for four years and has been very responsible with her repayments.  Coralia will use this loan to buy basic supplies such as twenty yards of Dacron material, three crochet rolls, three rolls of Clia crochet rolls, thread cones, elastic, forty-five yards of material and more.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies such as twenty yards of Dacron material, three crochet rolls, three rolls of Clia crochet rolls, thread cones, elastic, forty-five yards of material and more.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Doña Maribel de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cinco hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra maíz y frijol cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía, con las ganancias que obtienen de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, doña Maribel esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicida, etc. para seguir con sus cosechas y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: 60-year-old Maribel lives in her own house with her husband and her five children. She has made a living from agriculture for several years. She plants corn and beans. When the harvest is ready she stores her crops in the silos shown in the photograph. With the profits she obtains from her sales she manages to cover her household expenses. Maribel is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, herbicide, etc. and continue sowing and harvesting so she can give her family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, herbicide, etc

loans.name: Moris

texts.es: Morís de 45 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en casa propia, es un hombre luchador y responsable para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para la subsistencia. Actualmente trabaja vendiendo tortas mexicanas cerca de su lugar de residencia cerca de una zona industrial desde hace varios años tiene mucha clientela fija pues da a un buen precio las tortas, Morís desea realizar algunos cambios en su vivienda como la construcción de dos cuartos para sus hijas, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión por eso que solicita un crédito para comprar los materiales como ladrillos, cementos, arena, hierro y pagar la mano de obra a las personas que le realizaran el trabajo para que sus hijas tengan su cuarto y todos puedan vivir mas comodos y seguros.
texts.en: Morís is 45 years old and lives in his privately-owned house with his wife and four children.  He is feisty and responsible and works so that his family does not need for anything.  Morís currently makes a living selling Mexican tarts near his home, and near to an industrial area of town.  He has been doing this work for some years and has regular customers because of his good prices.  Morís wants to make some changes to his home, including building two rooms for his daughter.  However, he does not have a large enough income for such an investment and so is applying for a loan in order to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron and to pay the labourers who will do the work.  With the new rooms, all the family will be safer and more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron and to pay for labourers.

loans.name: Luz Del Transito

texts.es: Luz de 42 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en su lugar de residencia en una localidad muy transitada, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda como granos básicos, azúcar, aceite, golosinas, refrescos, etc. asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luz is 42 years old and lives with her husband and their two children.  Luz has a shop where she sells staple goods, including beans, milk, eggs and bread.  She has had the business for many years, giving Luz experience in sales and allowing her to earn higher profits.  Luz runs the shop out her home, in an area which has many passers-by.  She is known by the neighbours and has a lot of customers as she has the shop well-stocked.  Luz wants to expand the business and invest more but she needs capital.  So, she is applying for a loan that will allow her to buy necessary items for her shop, such as basic grains, sugar, oil, sweets, soft drinks and more.  She assures us that she will pay off her debt and is confident that this loan will provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sugar, oil, sweets, soft drinks and more.

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe PS est constitué de quatre femmes qui ont bénéficié de prêts remboursés sans difficultés depuis 2008. Elles ont comme activité principale le commerce.

Madame Aminata la représentante est la trésorière du Banc Villageois; elle est âgée de 44 ans elle est la première épouse de son mari qui en a deux, elle est mère de 6 enfants dont 2 filles. Elle a une boutique à domicile et vend aussi des cartes de recharges téléphoniques des trois opérateurs qui existent dans le pays.Elle a une bonne expérience de 10 ans.Elle a levé la main gauche.

Elle compte avec son prêt acheter 50000 F de cartes de recharges, 200000 F de marchandises ( riz, lait, sucre, savon....) pour renforcer sa boutique et se faire plus de revenus. La vente de cartes de recharge marche bien car elle est la seule distributrice du coin.

Avec ses bénéfices elle renforce son épargne,augmenter les marchandises de sa boutique afin qu'elle soit mieux achalandée.
texts.en:
This solidarity credit group is made up of four women who have taken and repaid loans without any difficulty since 2008.  Their main activity is retail.

Aminata, the group's representative, is also the treasurer of the Banc Villageois.  She is 44 years old and her husband's first (out of two) wife.  She is the mother of six children, including two girls.

Aminata has a shop inside her house, and she sells prepaid phone cards issued by the country's three providers.  She has ten years of experience in this field.  In the photo, she is the woman raising her left hand.

She plans to use her loan to buy 50,000 francs worth of prepaid phone cards as well as 200,000 francs worth of various goods (rice, milk, sugar, soap...) in order to strengthen her business and increase her income.  The sale pf prepaid phone cards is going well, since she is the only distributor in the area.

With her profits, Aminata boosts her savings and increases her stock of merchandise in her shop in order to have a larger inventory.

loans.use: to buy prepaid phone cards and increase her shop's inventory.

loans.name: Carlos  Antonio

texts.es: Carlos de 45 años de edad es un hombre muy trabajador quien vive junto a su señora esposa y sus dos hijos. Él posee un negocio de transporte Express a través de 1 vehículo que es de su propiedad, sin embargo adicional a esto posee una pequeña tienda en donde se mantienen sus hijos atendiéndola lo cual le genera ganancias extras a aparté de los viajes, con las ganancias que obtienen  de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos de su hogar,  Carlos solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito por medio del cual pueda comprar repuestos y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo para seguir con los negocios pues esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: 45-year-old Carlos is a very hard-working man who lives with his wife and their two children. He has a transportation business with one vehicle, which he owns; however he also has a small store, which his children look after and which generates extra income for him. He manages to settle his household expenses with the earnings he obtains from his work. Carlos is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral, with which he will be able to buy spare parts and do maintenance on his vehicle so he can continue with his businesses, as they are his only source of work, and give his family more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and do maintenance on his vehicle

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: Francisco de cincuenta y un años de edad, reside en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposa, Francisco se dedica  a la venta de relojes. Su negocio lo tiene ubicado en una zona de mucho tránsito de personas,  gracias a su amabilidad, creatividad y a la gran variedad de productos que mantiene ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchos clientes los cuales lo prefieren por ser un hombre responsable, trabajador y dedicado en su negocio. Ha decidido solicitar a INTEGRAL un credito para comprar mayor variedad de relojes, baterías por mayor y poder surtir su negocio de tal manera que logre atraer a más clientes que le permitan mejorar su nivel de ventas así como su nivel de ingresos para poder acceder a una mejor calidad de vida con su familia.
texts.en: 51-year-old Francisco lives in his own house with his two children and his wife. Francisco makes a living from selling watches. His business is located in a busy area. Thanks to his friendliness, his creativity, and the great variety of products he has, he has managed to gain the trust of many customers who prefer his business because he is a hard-working and responsible man who is dedicated to his business. He has decided to request a loan from Apoyo Integral so he can buy a greater variety of watches and batteries wholesale to restock his business and attract more customers. This will improve his level of sales and his income and will enable him and his family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy watches and batteries wholesale

loans.name: Inelia Del Carmen

texts.es: Inelia es una mujer de 24 años de edad, soltera, desde hace 8 años se dedica a vender cosa de horno, revueltas, bollo, rosquillas, tamales rellenos y tamales pisques, ambulante en el municipio de Nandasmo departamento de Masaya, sus productos por su calidad son bien reconocidos en su comunidad, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como maíz, queso, hojas de chagüites, leña, cal, azúcar, canela, sal etc.
texts.en: Inelia is a single 24-year-old woman. For eight years she has made a living by selling oven-cooked food, scrambled eggs, bread rolls, donuts, stuffed tamales, bean tamales, etc. on the streets of Nandasmo, which is in the department of Masaya. Her products are well-recognized in her community for their quality. She will invest the loan in purchasing raw material, such as corn, cheese, leaves, firewood, lime, sugar, cinnamon, and salt.

loans.use: to purchase raw material, such as corn, cheese, leaves, firewood, lime, sugar, cinnamon, and salt

loans.name: Las Morenas Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras, María es una mujer de 31 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos, su negocio es la producción de hamacas en su domicilio, desde hace 8 años  y las comercializa en el mercado de Masaya y los mercados de la capital, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como 20 lbs de manilas, bolillos de palo, 20 docenas de pelotas, 20 docenas de argollas, 21 lbs de manilas brazos etc. Martha es una mujer de 32 años de edad y su negocio es tener una pulpería en su domicilio y Yelba tiene 28 años de edad y su negocio es la compra y venta de cosechas de tamarindo.
texts.en: This group is made up of three enterprising members.María is a 31 year old woman. She is married and has two children. Her business has been making hammocks in her home for 8 years. She sells them in the markets in Masaya and the capital. She will invest the loan in buying raw materials such as 20 pounds of manila rope,  wooden bobbins, 20  dozen balls, 20 dozen rings, hangers, etc. Martha is a 32 year old woman and her business is a little store at her house and Yelba is 28 years old and her business is buying and selling tamarind harvests.

loans.use: to invest in buying raw materials such as 20 pounds of manila rope, wooden bobbins,  20 dozen rings, hangers, etc.

loans.name: Enkhtuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhtuya, 55 years old, lives with her husband and stepdaughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family currently resides in an apartment because they are repairing and insulating their house in preparation for the next harsh winter. 

Enkhtuya has been working as a cook at a restaurant since 2009. Her second husband is a machinist at a private business entity. Her ex-husband lives in the countryside and raises livestock while their son studies at a university. 

Her son, who excels in academics, is participating in a cultural exchange (study-abroad) program in Germany. For this reason, he is in urgent need of money. 

Enkhtuya is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to contribute to her son's education expenses, specifically to pay for his flight cost from Mongolia to Germany. Enkhtuya is very proud of her son and wants him to study well.

loans.use: to cover her son's cost to fly to Germany for a study-abroad program.

loans.name: Erlindo

texts.en: Erlindo, who is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental, is married and has three children. To make a living, he operates a service-based business providing transportation services to the local community. He is borrowing an amount of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase a new set of tires for his motorcycle transport business. Erlindo hopes to improve his service in order to generate more income from the business.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of tires.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Aminata from Waterloo, which is in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with one child, age 3. 

In 1996, Aminata established her clothing sales business. She began her business because she was trained in this business. She works nine hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenges she faces are a lack of capital to run her business and a less-than-optimal business location.

Aminata requires a loan in order to buy more wax cotton. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business. In the future, Aminata plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more wax cotton.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con su padre, su hermana y su hijo de 3 años es madre soltera, ella tiene una pequeña tienda en la que vende Productos perecederos como refrescos, golosinas, dulce y otras serie de artículos comestibles y no comestibles; a través de  este comercio ha sacado adelante a su familia. Ella busca mejorar su calidad  de  vida y la de su familia,  por lo que solicita un crédito para incrementar la variedad de sus  artículos en su tienda, como: granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, etc.  Lo que le permitiría incrementar las ganancias de  su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en: This client lives with her father, her sister, and her 3 year old son. She is a single mother. She has a little store where she sells perishable products such as beverages, snacks, candies and other edible and non-edible products. Through this business she has gotten her family ahead. She is seeking a better quality of life for her and her family. That is why she is asking for a loan to increase the variety of items in her store, such as basic grains, beverages, snacks, etc. This will allow her to increase her profits in her business and improve the quality of life of her family group.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, beverages, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Mungunkhuyag

texts.en:
Mr. Mungunkhuyag, 37 years old, lives with his wife, daughter and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has been working as an auditor at a general aviation business for 17 consecutive years and is considered by his fellows as an experienced and skilled staff member. 

The house the family lives in has deteriorated through the years and it needs some serious repairs. Mungunkhuyag is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, planks, fiberglass and foam. Using these materials, he can repair and insulate his brick house and create comfortable and warm accommodations for his family. 

The renovated house also will enable the family to reduce its coal consumption greatly, thus contributing to the effort to reduce air pollution by releasing less pollutants. Mungunkhuyag is a very hardworking individual who deeply cares for his family members.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Melona

texts.en:
Melona is a 34-year-old woman from the community of Carlos P. Garcia, Bohol. She is married with five children between the ages of 1 and 12. 

Melona farms rice and coconuts for a living. This has been her business for 10 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farm, which will help her boost her crops' growth and productivity.  

The loan will pave the way so Melona can continue to support her farm while also meeting the needs of her family.

In the future, Melona hopes to expand her business and continue to send her children to school so they can have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Juan Israel

texts.es:
JUAN tiene 28 años se caso hace poco tiene un hijo de meis meses, vive con la esposa y con el hijo en la ciudad de Guaranda Provincia Bolívar.

La VRC Tagma Rumiñahui, esta conformada por 14 socios casi a 25 minutos de la oficina de San Simón, se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

JUAN se dedica al cultivo y venta de maiz y frejol, y a la crianza y venta de pollos y vacas. Solicita el crédito para comprar unas vacas, semillas, abonos para los cultivos y balanceado.

El sueño de Juan es tener simpre trabajo para ayudar a su hijo a dar una buena educacion. El desafío al que el señor se enfrenta es el cambio de clima.

En la fietas de carnaval le gusta mucho compartir con la familia y los amigos.
texts.en:
JUAN is 28 years old. He was married a short time ago and has a six month old son. He lives with his wife and son in the city of Guaranda, Bolivar province. 

The Tagma Rumiñahui communal bank is made up of 14 members. It is almost 25 from the San Simón office. They work in agriculture and raising livestock. 

JUAN grows corn and beans and raises and sells cattle and chickens. He is asking for the loan to buy some cows as well as seeds, fertilizer for the crops and feed.

Juan's dream is to always work to help his son and give him a good education. His challenge is facing weather changes. 

During carnaval he likes to spend time with his family and friends.

loans.use: to buy some cows, seeds. and fertilizer for crops as well as feed.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
JUAN tiene 31 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en la ciudad de Guaranda Provincia Bolívar.

La VRC Tagma Rumiñahui, esta conformada por 14 socios casi a 25 minutos de la oficina de San Simón, se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

JUAN  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz suave, frejol.
Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, insecticidas para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito comprará lo que tanta falta le hacía.

El sueño de Juan es comprar un un pedazo mas grande de terreno para comprar animales como pollos y vacas.

En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar boli con los amigos.
texts.en:
Juan is 31 years old, single and doesn't have any children.  He lives in the city of Guaranda, in Bolívar province.

The Tagma Rumiñahui community bank has 14 members who farm and raise livestock.  They are located almost 25 minutes from the San Simón office.

Juan is a farmer who grows corn and beans.  He is requesting this loan to buy seeds, urea and insecticides for his crops.  With the support of this loan he will buy what he needs so badly.

Juan's dream is to buy a larger plot of land so that he can buy animals such as chickens and cows.

In his spare time, Juan enjoys playing volleyball with his friends.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea and insecticides for his crops

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda, 55, lives in Prenza, Tangub City. She is married and has three children. 

For more than 30 years, Rosalinda has managed a gardening business, planting papaya and vegetables to sell. Her monthly income averages 5,000 Philippine pesos. 

She has requested a loan of 6,800 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings. In the future, she hopes to expand her garden to sustain her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a 47-year old farmer. He has been planting and harvesting rice for more than 10 years. He sustains his family with his income from selling the harvested crops. 

Nelson would like to improve his rice farming business. He has asked for a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to use on his farm. 

He hopes to keep achieving abundant harvests to maintain the business and generate good profits for his family.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to use on his farm

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
MARIA tiene 44 años, es soltera tiene 3 hijos de 14,11 y 9 años de edad, vive con sus hijos en la ciudad de Guaranda Provincia Bolívar.

La VRC Tagma Rumiñahui, esta conformada por 14 socios casi a 25 minutos de la oficina de San Simón, se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

MARIA se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos, así como también el cultivo de papas. Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos semillas fertilizantes y balanceados para los animales.

Con el apoyo del  crédito podrá guardar el capital que tenía para poder trabajar con el dinero del crédito.

El sueño de Maria es comprar contar saiempre con el trbajo para dar la educacion a los hijos.

El desafío al que se enfrenta la señora es el transporte.
En su tiempo libre le gusta conversar con los hijos y ayudar hacer la tarea.
texts.en:
Maria is 44 years old, single and she has three children who are 14, 11 and 9 years old.  She lives with her children in the city of Guaranda in Bolívar Province.

The “Tagma Rumiñahui” communal bank is made up of 14 members and is almost 25 minutes from the San Simón office. The members work in agriculture and livestock breeding.

Maria works raising and selling chickens as well as growing potatoes.  She is requesting the loan to buy manure, seeds, fertilizer and balanced feed for the animals.  With the support of the loan she will be able to preserve her capital and put the money from the loan to work instead.

Maria’s dream is to always have work in order to give her children an education.  The challenge that she faces is transportation.

In her free time she likes to talk with her children and help them do homework.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizer and balanced feed for the animals.

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita is from Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old, married and has 4 children. Aside from planting and harvesting corn, she also has had a coconut farm, raising coconuts to sell.  

She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC micro-credit which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Ochirtamga

texts.en:
Mr. Ochirtamga, 55 years old, lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own old house on a plot of land. He has been working as a machinist, a driver and a plumber at private business entities since 2002 and accumulated a vast amount of work experience. His wife also works as a janitor at the same place where he works, and they met there and eventually got married. The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years and needs some serious repair. 

So he is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors, shingles for roofing, fiberglass, foam and a metal door. Using these materials, he can repair and insulate his house, thus providing more comfortable and warmer accommodations for his family members. Also, the renovated house will enable the family to reduce their coal consumption greatly, thus contributing directly to the efforts against air pollution by releasing less pollutants. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is a 56-year-old woman living in CPG, Bohol. She is married, and her husband works as a farmer. Saturnina has owned a Sari-sari (variety) store business for four years now where she sells coffee, detergent, shampoo, cooking oil and eggs.    

She is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy rice, soft drinks, seasonings and toiletries. She hopes to improve her store inventory and hopefully make it bigger someday.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks, seasonings and toiletries.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 35 years old and a mother of three. She owns and manages a small variety store in her village to generate income. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she aims to improve her business and increase her income in order to support the education of her children. 

Since she has inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP6,000 to buy more stocks of canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, beverages, snack foods and seasonings to sell. Felicidad is very optimistic that her requested loan will be granted, for it will really help her improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, beverages, snack foods and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Khurelbagana

texts.en:
Mr. Khurelbagana, 35 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running a shoe sales business for two years by renting a stall at a trade center. His wife is pregnant and stays at home looking after their third child. Their other two children go to high school. 

Before the shoe selling business, he and his wife had been working in Korea on an employment contract between Mongolia and Korea. When they came back to Mongolia after their contract expired, they came with a large amount of casual clothes and shoes to begin their business. Now their business is prospering each passing day, and they have rented two more stalls at other trade centers.

He is requesting a loan of 4,200,000 MNT to purchase shoes in large amounts from Korea in order to increase his working capital. As a result, he can continue to run his business without worrying about inventory shortage. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who greatly cares for his family.

loans.use: to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Julito

texts.en: Julito is a fisherman from the town of Ubay, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of two young children. Fishing is his source of income. He is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other supplies. With this, he will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Julito dreams of making his business a success, of saving money for the future schooling of his children, and to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other supplies.

loans.name: Bud

texts.en:
Mr. Bud, 26 years old, lives with his wife in Kherlen, the easternmost city of Mongolia. The family has recently purchased a house and a plot of land.
