He has been working as an assistant at a building company since 2012. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home. The house they purchased was built ten years ago, and over the years it has severely deteriorated. 

So, he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, planks, shingles, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, he can repair and insulate his house, improving it to its original state with a better appearance. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke and so contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Chanry

texts.en:
Chanry is 48 years old. She is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been employed as a nurse for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a construction foreman who makes an income of $6 each day. 

In order to improve her husband’s business, Chanry is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more construction tools to use in his work. This purchase will enable him to bid for bigger construction projects and earn more income for the family. 

In the future, she would like to build a fence around her house and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more construction tools for her husband to use in his work.

loans.name: Luis Alexander

texts.es:
Luis tiene 22 años es casado tien un hijo de 2 meses de nacido vive en Guaranda Provincia de Bolivar.

Se dedica a la albañeria en trabajos de construccion de casa, el dienro los solicita para comprar una licuadora y otra parte para sacar la licencia de conducir. El credito le va ayudar a cumplir con lo que necesita.

El sueño de luis es tener casa propia.

En los momentos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en: Luis is 22 years old, married, and has one son who is two months old. He lives in the city of Guaranda in the province of Bolívar. He works in bricklaying, masonry and building houses. He is requesting a loan to buy a blender and to pay for the costs of obtaining his driver’s license. He says the loan is going to help him with what he needs. Luis’s dream is to have his own home. In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy a blender and to pay for the costs of obtaining his driver’s license.

loans.name: Efrenor

texts.en:
Efrenor is a farmer living in Dalaoig with his wife and children. He and his wife plant and harvest corn to sell. They also raise hogs to sell. Efrenor and his family works hard in order make enough money to pay his children's school fees. In the farming business, they usually earn about P30,000 twice a year during harvest season.

He wanted to improve his crop production, so he needs to give enough nutrition to his crops. That is why he is now asking for a loan of P50,000. He will buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides to use in his farming.

Efrenor is confident that he will harvest abundant crops because of giving them enough farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides needed in his farming.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Mrs. Rina, 42 years old, lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. She has been working as a cook at a cafeteria for quite a long time. Using her previous loan, she purchased an automobile for her husband to use for taxi service. 

Now she is requesting a loan of 2,800,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, planks, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, she and her husband want to add an extension and insulation to their old house as well as to repair its outer and interior components. 

The renovated house will enable the family to reduce their coal consumption, release less pollutants and thus contribute to the efforts against air pollution. She is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to add an extension and insulation to the house as well as to make repairs.

loans.name: Arely

texts.en:
Arely is entering the world of an entrepreneur running a party supply business offering tables, chairs and moonwalks for rent in the Conroe, Texas community.

Originally from Matehuala, Mexico, Arely ventured to Accion Texas Inc. for a loan to begin her business. Now that she has applied and was approved for a $5,450 loan, Arely was able to create one full-time and two part-time jobs.

Without the loan, the 27-year-old would not have been able to purchase items to rent out, and would therefore, not be in business at the moment.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and create one full-time and two part-time jobs.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin resides in Houston but is a long way from home.  His original hometown of London, England had been his address before moving to Texas.  With five years of experience, his start-up business, Prestigious Movers, has been in business for the past 10 months with one full-time employee. 
 
He and his employee spend the days moving furniture for customers using the best customer service and professionalism during each job.  Serving the Houston area, the state of Texas, and beyond – their reach has no borders.  Customers can expect a flat rate charge depending on the amount of furniture being moved and time it takes to do so.  Martin stresses his competitive prices that are both reasonable and fair. 
 
Other services provided by Martin and his company include removal of goods, wrapping delicates, and picking up ordered furniture for his customers.  

Martin came to Accion Texas Inc. when a friend informed him about the organization that assists the Houston community with capital for their companies.  Martin was intrigued due to the fact that he was spending $400 a month in rental fees for delivery trucks to move customers.  He received approval for an Accion loan and proceeded to purchase a box truck to offset the monthly rental costs of a moving truck.  Other portions of the loan were used to pay for his full-time employee and continue to offer competitive wages to retain his employee.  Martin says, “I would be stuck in the same cycle, having to rent a moving truck and barely make money from each job.”  He plans to hire four additional full-time employees when business picks up and there is a demand. 

You can read more about Martin’s company on his website, www.prestigiousmovers.com.

loans.use: to purchase a delivery truck and pay his employee.

loans.name: Manuel Mesias

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 27 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con  unos familiares en la ciudad de Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

Manuel se dedica a dar los servicios en una mecánica. Solicita el crédito para comprar una máquina soldadora, tuercas, filtros de aire, filtro de aceite.

Con la ayuda del crédito podría comprar lo necesario para el taller. Las compras las realizará en Guaranda.  El sueño es mejorar el nivel de vida.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boli.
texts.en:
Manuel is 27 years old, single, and has no children. He lives with some of his family in the city of Chimbo in the province of Bolívar.

Manuel works as a mechanic. He is requesting a loan to buy a welding machine, nuts, air filters and oil filters. With the help of the loan he will be able to buy what he needs for the workshop. He will make his purchases in Guaranda. His dream is to improve his standard of living. The challenges he faces are competition. In his free time he likes to play volleyball.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine, nuts, air filters and oil filters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional grocery items such as vinegar, cooking oil, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from CPG, Bohol. She runs a 'sari-sari' or variety store business selling various types of goods to the people in her place.

Laura is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, sodas and  beverages, soap and detergents. With this, she will be able to improve her store and attract more buyers, thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Laura dreams of improving her store and making it a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, sodas and  beverages, soap and detergents

loans.name: Jargalsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Jargalsaikhan, 58 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has been rendering taxi service for twenty-three years and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in picking up customers, driving them to their destination quickly and shortening routes. His wife previously worked as a cook at a military base but due to bad health, she quit her job and now stays at home looking after her niece. His two sons both work in Korea on employment contracts. His elder daughter has a position as a nurse at a hospital while his younger daughter works as a program director at a television entity. 

Jargalsaikhan is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, planks, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, he wants to make an extension and add insulation to his house as his house provides not enough space for the whole family and over the years, the house has deteriorated and in wintertime, it loses heat dramatically. Also, the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke and so contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Vergilio

texts.en: Vergilio, a sixty-five-year-old married man with two children, lives in Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale. He borrowed an amount of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC to finance the costs of weeding maintenance for the farm. Rogelio wants to improve the farm in order to have an abundant harvest.

loans.use: To finance the costs of weeding maintenance

loans.name: Phanny's Group

texts.en:
Phanny, a 35 year-old mother of three schoolchildren, is a farmer who grows sugarcane as the main source of income. To support their living, her husband works at construction site. The current business which she has been with for 10 years, has returned her about 15,300 KHR per day. 

Phanny has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for five cycles. After the successful loan that she has repaid, she feels confident that she can raise the living status of her family. 

Now she forms a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and a remaining portion to renovate her house. She hopes that she can gain a high yield from her crop and earn more profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and to renovate her house.

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
Channy, a villager residing in Kandal Province, is 57 years old and a mother of two children. To tackle the daily cost of living, she grows sugarcane as the main income generating activity. She has been involved in the current business for 32 years. Her current income is about 16,700 KHR per day. 

Including this cycle, she is a six-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She can support her business as well as maintain her family’s living condition from the past loan, which she has fully paid back. 

Now she leads a group of two female members to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy necessary material to support her sugarcane plantation and to buy fish for her child for resale. She hopes that she can increase their income and improve their lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials to support her sugarcane plantation and to buy fish for her child for resale.

loans.name: Lanh's Group

texts.en:
A 63-year-old mother of one child, Lanh is a local farmer from Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. For the sake of her family, she solely depends on a single business: two hectares and a half of rice farming. She is able to earn up to 10,200 KHR per day from the business, which she has had for 12 years. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Lanh is a second-time borrower. Her original loan has improved her lifestyle and provided sufficient food for her family. Now, she forms a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to plow her farmland in order to be ready for upcoming replanting season. She hopes to double her income so she can sustain her living.

loans.use: To plow her farmland.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is married and has four children. She is 31 years old and lives in Tangub City, Philippines. Vivian owns and operates a business providing manicures in the local community. She also manages their own farm, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Recently, she borrowed an amount of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure.   In the future, Vivian hopes to see her children finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

location.town: Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Rat's Group

texts.en:
A 30-year-old single lady from Kampong Cham province, Rat struggles to earn the daily cost of living via growing rice & cassava as her primary source of income. To supplement her income to cover the family’s needs, she also raises buffalo and works for others for a fee. She has been engaged in the current businesses for several years, earning about 22,200 KHR per day. This is the first microloan for Rat’s group consisting of two female members; both of them are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. 

Rat is the group leader, and she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava and her paddy rice. She sincerely hopes that her business will return a good yield with a high profit so that she can buy more farmland to expand her cash-crop business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cassava and her rice

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Rhine Sheila

texts.en:
Rhine Sheila is 24 years old, single and lives in San Antonio, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She earns a living by providing transportation services. She went into this line of work almost three years ago.  

To improve her business, Rhine Sheila is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP from GDMPC to repair the existing motor. She plans to improve her services to gather more costumers and generate additional income.

loans.use: to repair the existing motor.

loans.name: Elmie

texts.en:
Elmie, from Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, is 24 years old and single. 

To make a living, for the past three years Elmie has owned and operated a business selling food, especially buko salad, and he also he runs a general store. 

In 2011, Elmie joined GDMPC and he is now requesting a loan of 19,500 PHP to purchase additional inventory. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Maria Eda

texts.en:
Maria Eda of Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental is a 24-year-old single woman. She owns and manages a farm, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. 

She borrowed an amount of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to plants additional banana plants on the farm to generate additional income for her better future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is a hard-working mother who owns and manages a small variety store in her village. She is 56 years old, married, and has six adult-aged children. She and her husband aim to give their children a better living, thus they really want to improve their livelihood. 

With that, Perlita really desires to improve her variety store to generate more income. However, due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 to buy more stocks of soft drinks, detergent soaps, rice, noodles, cellphone load,  beverages, and seasonings to sell. She is very positive that, with the loan, she will generate higher income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of soft drinks, detergent soaps, rice, noodles, cellphone load,  beverages, and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeung district, Phal is a single woman who does rice cropping as the main source of income. The current business that she has been with for eight years has earned her about KHR 28,000 per day. This is the first microloan for Phal with VisionFund Cambodia, Kiva’s partner. 

In a group of four, Phal is the leader. All of them, including Phal, are seeking the same loan amount of KHR 160,000. 

Phal will spend her loan portion to buy below-the-ground materials for latrine construction for her family. She hopes that she can own a decent latrine for her household in order to improve hygienic practices in her family.

loans.use: to buy below-the-ground materials for latrine construction.

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en:
Sarom is 42 years old, married, and has five children. Currently, three children still rely on her as two of them are still in school while the remaining one is too young for schooling. Sarom earns a living through rice farming which she has been with for 15 years. From the current business, she is able to earn about 15,500 KHR per day and manages to save 5,000 KHR after deducting daily expenses. 

This is the first time for Sarom borrowing from VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Now she and her group member are seeking the same loan amount of   500,000 KHR each. Sarom is the leader and she will spend her loan portion to buy rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income so that she can better her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en: Tha is a mother of seven children, some of whom are still in school, and is a villager from Kampong Cham province. She manages one hectare of land for paddy rice growing, which she has done for a long time.  This is the first microloan for Tha and her group consisting of another nine members. All of them are seeking the same loan amount, 1,000,000 KHR each.  As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs for ploughing her farmland. She hopes that she can have sufficient capital to support her business on time and return her a good yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for labor cost that helps her to plough her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 38 years old.  She is single and has one child.  She is living in Kinuman Sur, Ozamiz City. To make a living, Vilma grows bananas to sell.  She also plants corn for sale and for the family's consumption.  Vilma is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which she will use to obtain farm fertilizers.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to obtain farm fertilizers.

loans.name: Hieng's Group

texts.en:
Hieng, a young mother of one dependent child from Pursat Province, is 26 years old and a local farmer who grows rice on three hectares as the main source of income. She is able to earn approximately 26,000 KHR per day from the current business that she has had for ages. 

This is the first time for Hieng with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is the leader of a group consisting of two female members. For Hieng, she will spend her loan portion to pay the reaping fee and to plow her farmland for replanting her paddy rice. She hopes this loan will help her to gather her yield on time and be ready for the upcoming rainy season rice growing.

loans.use: To pay the reaping fee and to plow her farmland for replanting her paddy rice.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is happy that the first loan helped him to stabilze his business. He seeks another loan of 10,650 Kenya shillings to add timber stock to his business. 

The major challenges he faced during the last loan term was competition and price fluctuation. He is still determined to educate his children and this remains his number one priority.

loans.use: to purchase timber for resale.

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en:
Savy is 30 years old and a widow with three dependent children. For the sake of her children, she plants rice on two hectares. This is a business that she has had for 10 years and she is able to earn up to 11,800 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for Savy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She and her joint borrowers, in a group of three, are seeking the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to plow her farmland and to buy fertilizer. She highly hopes that this loan will support her agribusiness and return her a good yield with good income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia, a married woman, a fifty-one years old with two children, lives in Prenza, Tangub City. To make a living, she owns and manages a store selling goods in the local community. In 2010, she joined GDMPC and she gained access to micro finance services. Recently, she borrowed the amount of 19,800 PHP to purchase canned goods, noodles, sugar and spices for sale. Virginia plans to saved a portion from her profit in order to have reserved fund for the future of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, sugar and spices for sale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and blessed with three children, two of whom attend school. She has been operating a cereals shop for the last five years. She sells cereals like maize and beans. Her husband is employed and earns a salary for the family. They also rear dairy cattle.

Florence learned about Milango through friends and now she is seeking a loan of 21,050 Kenya shilling to buy maize, beans and rice. She also has a vision of enlarging her dairy farming business and commercializing it. The major challenge for her business is unstable prices. 

The loan will help her educate her children and feed them.

loans.use: buy maize, beans and rice.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Oeun, age 51, is a married mother of three children, one of whom is still in school. To strive for a living, she has been farming rice on five hectares and growing cassava on six hectares of farmland as the main source of the family’s income while her husband works as a paid laborer. She has been involved with this business in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province for a long time. 

Oeun has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Now she is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and pay for labor to plant her cassava. She hopes to have a high yield and earn a larger income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for labor to plant her cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 31 years old, married and has five children. Rosenda and her spouse are farmers from Dalaoig. They plant and harvest corn to sell. Rosenda acquires P10,000 each harvest season, twice a year, and that serves to cover school expenses, meals and revolving capital for the business. 

Rosenda wants to achieve a plentiful harvest but has insufficient funds to sustain her crops. That is why she is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy fertilizer, corn seeds, and pay labor cost in farming. This will help make her business profitable, leading to a progressive life someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, corn seeds, and pay labor costs in farming

loans.name: Imtiaz

texts.en:
Imtiaz is a 53-year-old, hard-working woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband and one child. Her husband has been running a small shop, located at the corner of his street. 

Imtiaz has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. Since the summer season has arrived, to fulfill the demands of customers, her husband would keep some cold drinks in his shop. He would purchase cold drinks with the loan amount and this would increase his sales and income. 

Imtiaz is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks for his shop.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is a married woman and a mother of four children, from CPG, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business, together with her husband, for more than 15 years now. This is the source of her income.

Leonarda is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items. Through this loan, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Leonarda hopes of expanding their business, so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items.

loans.name: Jayson

texts.en:
Jayson is an industrious father. He supports his family through rice farming. Through the income that he is generating from the business, he is able to provide the daily needs of his family. But, as a father who wants to provide a better living for his family, Jayson wants to further improve his farming activities. 

With that, he is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 27,000. If this loan will be granted, he intends to buy additional seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides. He hopes that, with these essential needs of his farm, he could harvest more sacks of rice, which will lead to a higher income.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides for his rice farm.

loans.name: Remelie

texts.en:
Remelie is 25 years old, single, and lives in Migcanaway, Tangub City. 

To make a living, she manages a fishing business, catching fish for sale. In 2010, Remelie joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) and is now requesting a loan of PHP 18,200 to purchase a new set of fishing nets to be used for the business. 

She hopes to own a fishing boat, to be used to expand the business, for the better future of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of fishng nets.
